Title: Machine Learning Engineer – Den Haag
Description:
Over deze vacature

AI verandert onze wereld, maar in kritieke omgevingen moet het betrouwbaar, schaalbaar én veilig zijn. Bij TNO ontwikkelen we AI-gedreven systemen die samenwerken met fysieke processen (zoals sensoren en actuatoren) en zelfstandig beslissingen nemen in complexe situaties – van slimme energienetten en defensie-informatie tot digital twins voor biodiversiteit die milieubeleid ondersteunen.

Als Machine Learning Engineer draag je bij aan het onderzoek, de ontwikkeling en implementatie van machine learning-oplossingen die directe impact hebben op vitale infrastructuren. Je werkt samen met topexperts op het gebied van AI, distributed systems en software engineering om vernieuwende toepassingen te ontwikkelen die de brug slaan tussen fundamenteel onderzoek en praktische implementatie. Daarbij onderzoek je ook hoe systemen presteren en werk je aan het verbeteren van veiligheid en bestuurbaarheid.

Je thuisbasis is de researchgroep Intelligent Cyber-physical Systems Engineering (ICSE). Vanuit Groningen en Den Haag werken hier meer dan 35 wetenschappers, onderzoekers en consultants dagelijks aan de waarde van digitale toepassingen. Je werkt nauw samen met collega’s uit andere afdelingen en units. ICSE is een divers team met mensen van verschillende leeftijden, achtergronden en nationaliteiten. We delen een passie voor toegepast onderzoek, hebben een open en informele sfeer, ondersteunen elkaar en staan open voor jouw ideeën!

Wat ga je doen?

Als Machine Learning Engineer ben je betrokken bij de hele lifecycle van ML-oplossingen van onderzoek en experiment tot het bouwen en implementeren van robuuste AI-systemen. Je werkzaamheden omvatten onder andere


Ontwikkelen van Machine Learning software die autonomie bevordert in cyber-fysieke systemen.
Bouwen van proof-of-concept applicaties en demonstrators die AI-onderzoek vertalen naar praktische en schaalbare toepassingen.
Optimaliseren en implementeren van ML-modellen met focus op prestaties, betrouwbaarheid en efficiëntie.
Samenwerken in multidisciplinaire teams met experts in AI, systeemengineering en domeinspecifieke toepassingen.
Verkennen van de nieuwste AI-technieken en beoordelen van hun inzetbaarheid in kritieke infrastructuren en in interactie met fysieke processen.
Werken met klanten en partners om bestaande en nieuwe vraagstukken op te lossen met state-of-the-art ML-technologie.




Voorbeelden van lopende projecten


AI Agents voor Militaire Inlichtingen – Generatieve AI-agents die analisten ondersteunen bij het filteren van grootschalige data voor bruikbare inzichten.
GPT-NL – Bijdragen aan datacuratie en trainingspijplijnen voor het eerste grootschalige, legitieme Nederlandse taalmodel op AI-gebied.
Duurzaam (her)produceren – AI-gebaseerde beslisondersteuning voor het optimaliseren van retourstromen in de industrie.




Wat wij van jou verwachten

Je bent een ambitieuze Machine Learning Engineer met een stevige technische basis en een passie om AI toe te passen op echte, maatschappelijke uitdagingen. Je vindt het belangrijk om betrouwbare en veilige digitale oplossingen te bouwen en je voelt je thuis in een omgeving met verschillende expertises.

Daarnaast breng je het volgende mee


Een afgeronde master of PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence of een verwant vakgebied.
Sterke samenwerkings- en communicatieve vaardigheden om effectief te werken in multidisciplinaire teams.
Een proactieve en zelfstandige werkhouding.
Ervaring met Python en bereidheid om andere talen/platforms te leren zoals Rust, TypeScript, Java of Go. Kennis van én bij voorkeur ervaring met frameworks zoals PyTorch of TensorFlow.
Een analytische mindset en nieuwsgierigheid naar nieuwe AI-technieken, gecombineerd met een kritische en pragmatische blik op de inzet ervan.




En één of meer van de volgende punten


Kennis van software engineering principes, zoals MLOps en DevOps. Ervaring met het ontwerpen en integreren van distributed systems, monitoring en dataverwerking.
Wiskundige achtergrond in modelleren van bijvoorbeeld fysieke processen, en ervaring met het omzetten daarvan naar code.
Interesse in engineeringfasen zoals ontwerp, validatie, lifecycle management en systeembeoordeling. Bij voorkeur ervaring met conceptuele modelleertechnieken zoals UML of SysML.




Ook als je niet aan álle eisen voldoet, moedigen we je aan om te reageren.

Wat wij jou bieden

Uitdagend én afwisselend werk met serieuze impact. En volop kansen, want bij TNO heb je grotendeels zelf de regie over je carrière. Naast een bruto (fulltime) maandsalaris tussen € 3.385,- en € 5.000,- (afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring), vakantiegeld (8%), een dertiende maand (8,33%) en een flexbudget (5,58% + €180), krijg je alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontwikkelen.

Misschien wil je doorgroeien in de richting commercie of consultancy. Of wil je projectmanager worden, jezelf meer verdiepen in duurzame innovaties of carrière maken als technisch expert.

Daarnaast kun je bij TNO een ‘menu’ aan arbeidsvoorwaarden samenstellen dat bij jouw persoonlijke situatie past. Wat je ook mag verwachten


Een uiterst professionele, innovatieve werkomgeving, met topexperts als collega’s.
Mogelijkheid om cursussen, opleidingen en workshops te volgen en congressen te bezoeken, en coaching als je daar behoefte aan hebt.
33 vakantiedagen (bij een fulltime dienstverband).
Een werkgever die divers talent waardeert en stimuleert, met initiatieven als het Female Leadership Programma, onze Rainbow Community en round tables over inclusiethema’s.
Een uitgebreide en flexibele mobiliteitsregeling , inclusief volledige vergoeding van openbaar vervoer voor woon-werk en zakelijke reizen.
Gezellige activiteiten met je team en andere TNO'ers . Zo leer je snel veel mensen kennen.
Flexibele werktijden, de mogelijkheid om parttime (32 of 36 uur) te werken en de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken.
Toegang tot ons Talent Development Programme .
Netwerkmogelijkheden en leuke activiteiten georganiseerd door Jong TNO .
Een goede pensioenregeling.




Lees hier uit welke arbeidsvoorwaarden je verder kunt kiezen.

TNO als werkgever

Bij TNO innoveren we voor een gezonder, veiliger en duurzamer leven. En voor een sterke economie. Sinds 1932 ontwikkelen wij kennis en technologie voor het algemeen belang. We vinden elkaar in verwondering en vindingrijkheid, en we zijn gedreven om grenzen te verleggen. Voor jouw talent en ambitie is er alle ruimte en ondersteuning. Je werkt samen met mensen die aan je gewaagd zijn, die jou inspireren én van jou willen leren. Onze state-of-the-art-faciliteiten zijn er om jouw visie te verwezenlijken. Wat je bij TNO doet, doet ertoe impact maakt het verschil. Want met elke innovatie draag je bij aan het leven van morgen. Lees meer over TNO als werkgever .

Bij TNO stimuleren we een inclusieve werkomgeving, waar jij jezelf kunt zijn. Wat je verhaal ook is en welke unieke eigenschappen je ook meebrengt. Juist door onze unieke krachten en perspectieven te bundelen zijn we in staat om innovaties te ontwikkelen die een wezenlijk verschil maken in de samenleving. Meer weten? Lees welke stappen wij zetten op het gebied van diversiteit, gelijkwaardigheid en inclusie .

Hoe ziet het proces eruit?

Reageren kan tot en met 7 september 2025. De sollicitatieprocedure bestaat uit twee gespreksrondes. De eerste ronde staat gepland op 18 september 2025. De tweede ronde staat gepland op 22 september 2025. In een laatste gesprek bespreken we de arbeidsvoorwaarden die je zelf samenstelt. We streven ernaar de hele procedure binnen vier weken af te ronden.

Een online assessment en referentiecheck kunnen onderdeel uitmaken van de selectieprocedure.

Als je bij ons komt werken vragen wij je ook een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG) te overleggen.


Show more
HTML:
Over deze vacature

AI verandert onze wereld, maar in kritieke omgevingen moet het betrouwbaar, schaalbaar én veilig zijn. Bij TNO ontwikkelen we AI-gedreven systemen die samenwerken met fysieke processen (zoals sensoren en actuatoren) en zelfstandig beslissingen nemen in complexe situaties – van slimme energienetten en defensie-informatie tot digital twins voor biodiversiteit die milieubeleid ondersteunen.

Als Machine Learning Engineer draag je bij aan het onderzoek, de ontwikkeling en implementatie van machine learning-oplossingen die directe impact hebben op vitale infrastructuren. Je werkt samen met topexperts op het gebied van AI, distributed systems en software engineering om vernieuwende toepassingen te ontwikkelen die de brug slaan tussen fundamenteel onderzoek en praktische implementatie. Daarbij onderzoek je ook hoe systemen presteren en werk je aan het verbeteren van veiligheid en bestuurbaarheid.

Je thuisbasis is de researchgroep Intelligent Cyber-physical Systems Engineering (ICSE). Vanuit Groningen en Den Haag werken hier meer dan 35 wetenschappers, onderzoekers en consultants dagelijks aan de waarde van digitale toepassingen. Je werkt nauw samen met collega’s uit andere afdelingen en units. ICSE is een divers team met mensen van verschillende leeftijden, achtergronden en nationaliteiten. We delen een passie voor toegepast onderzoek, hebben een open en informele sfeer, ondersteunen elkaar en staan open voor jouw ideeën!

Wat ga je doen?

Als Machine Learning Engineer ben je betrokken bij de hele lifecycle van ML-oplossingen van onderzoek en experiment tot het bouwen en implementeren van robuuste AI-systemen. Je werkzaamheden omvatten onder andere

  • Ontwikkelen van Machine Learning software die autonomie bevordert in cyber-fysieke systemen.
  • Bouwen van proof-of-concept applicaties en demonstrators die AI-onderzoek vertalen naar praktische en schaalbare toepassingen.
  • Optimaliseren en implementeren van ML-modellen met focus op prestaties, betrouwbaarheid en efficiëntie.
  • Samenwerken in multidisciplinaire teams met experts in AI, systeemengineering en domeinspecifieke toepassingen.
  • Verkennen van de nieuwste AI-technieken en beoordelen van hun inzetbaarheid in kritieke infrastructuren en in interactie met fysieke processen.
  • Werken met klanten en partners om bestaande en nieuwe vraagstukken op te lossen met state-of-the-art ML-technologie.



Voorbeelden van lopende projecten

  • AI Agents voor Militaire Inlichtingen – Generatieve AI-agents die analisten ondersteunen bij het filteren van grootschalige data voor bruikbare inzichten.
  • GPT-NL – Bijdragen aan datacuratie en trainingspijplijnen voor het eerste grootschalige, legitieme Nederlandse taalmodel op AI-gebied.
  • Duurzaam (her)produceren – AI-gebaseerde beslisondersteuning voor het optimaliseren van retourstromen in de industrie.



Wat wij van jou verwachten

Je bent een ambitieuze Machine Learning Engineer met een stevige technische basis en een passie om AI toe te passen op echte, maatschappelijke uitdagingen. Je vindt het belangrijk om betrouwbare en veilige digitale oplossingen te bouwen en je voelt je thuis in een omgeving met verschillende expertises.

Daarnaast breng je het volgende mee

  • Een afgeronde master of PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence of een verwant vakgebied.
  • Sterke samenwerkings- en communicatieve vaardigheden om effectief te werken in multidisciplinaire teams.
  • Een proactieve en zelfstandige werkhouding.
  • Ervaring met Python en bereidheid om andere talen/platforms te leren zoals Rust, TypeScript, Java of Go. Kennis van én bij voorkeur ervaring met frameworks zoals PyTorch of TensorFlow.
  • Een analytische mindset en nieuwsgierigheid naar nieuwe AI-technieken, gecombineerd met een kritische en pragmatische blik op de inzet ervan.



En één of meer van de volgende punten

  • Kennis van software engineering principes, zoals MLOps en DevOps. Ervaring met het ontwerpen en integreren van distributed systems, monitoring en dataverwerking.
  • Wiskundige achtergrond in modelleren van bijvoorbeeld fysieke processen, en ervaring met het omzetten daarvan naar code.
  • Interesse in engineeringfasen zoals ontwerp, validatie, lifecycle management en systeembeoordeling. Bij voorkeur ervaring met conceptuele modelleertechnieken zoals UML of SysML.



Ook als je niet aan álle eisen voldoet, moedigen we je aan om te reageren.

Wat wij jou bieden

Uitdagend én afwisselend werk met serieuze impact. En volop kansen, want bij TNO heb je grotendeels zelf de regie over je carrière. Naast een bruto (fulltime) maandsalaris tussen € 3.385,- en € 5.000,- (afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring), vakantiegeld (8%), een dertiende maand (8,33%) en een flexbudget (5,58% + €180), krijg je alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontwikkelen.

Misschien wil je doorgroeien in de richting commercie of consultancy. Of wil je projectmanager worden, jezelf meer verdiepen in duurzame innovaties of carrière maken als technisch expert.

Daarnaast kun je bij TNO een ‘menu’ aan arbeidsvoorwaarden samenstellen dat bij jouw persoonlijke situatie past. Wat je ook mag verwachten

  • Een uiterst professionele, innovatieve werkomgeving, met topexperts als collega’s.
  • Mogelijkheid om cursussen, opleidingen en workshops te volgen en congressen te bezoeken, en coaching als je daar behoefte aan hebt.
  • 33 vakantiedagen (bij een fulltime dienstverband).
  • Een werkgever die divers talent waardeert en stimuleert, met initiatieven als het Female Leadership Programma, onze Rainbow Community en round tables over inclusiethema’s.
  • Een uitgebreide en flexibele mobiliteitsregeling , inclusief volledige vergoeding van openbaar vervoer voor woon-werk en zakelijke reizen.
  • Gezellige activiteiten met je team en andere TNO'ers . Zo leer je snel veel mensen kennen.
  • Flexibele werktijden, de mogelijkheid om parttime (32 of 36 uur) te werken en de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken.
  • Toegang tot ons Talent Development Programme .
  • Netwerkmogelijkheden en leuke activiteiten georganiseerd door Jong TNO .
  • Een goede pensioenregeling.



Lees hier uit welke arbeidsvoorwaarden je verder kunt kiezen.

TNO als werkgever

Bij TNO innoveren we voor een gezonder, veiliger en duurzamer leven. En voor een sterke economie. Sinds 1932 ontwikkelen wij kennis en technologie voor het algemeen belang. We vinden elkaar in verwondering en vindingrijkheid, en we zijn gedreven om grenzen te verleggen. Voor jouw talent en ambitie is er alle ruimte en ondersteuning. Je werkt samen met mensen die aan je gewaagd zijn, die jou inspireren én van jou willen leren. Onze state-of-the-art-faciliteiten zijn er om jouw visie te verwezenlijken. Wat je bij TNO doet, doet ertoe impact maakt het verschil. Want met elke innovatie draag je bij aan het leven van morgen. Lees meer over TNO als werkgever .

Bij TNO stimuleren we een inclusieve werkomgeving, waar jij jezelf kunt zijn. Wat je verhaal ook is en welke unieke eigenschappen je ook meebrengt. Juist door onze unieke krachten en perspectieven te bundelen zijn we in staat om innovaties te ontwikkelen die een wezenlijk verschil maken in de samenleving. Meer weten? Lees welke stappen wij zetten op het gebied van diversiteit, gelijkwaardigheid en inclusie .

Hoe ziet het proces eruit?

Reageren kan tot en met 7 september 2025. De sollicitatieprocedure bestaat uit twee gespreksrondes. De eerste ronde staat gepland op 18 september 2025. De tweede ronde staat gepland op 22 september 2025. In een laatste gesprek bespreken we de arbeidsvoorwaarden die je zelf samenstelt. We streven ernaar de hele procedure binnen vier weken af te ronden.

Een online assessment en referentiecheck kunnen onderdeel uitmaken van de selectieprocedure.

Als je bij ons komt werken vragen wij je ook een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG) te overleggen.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist (Data Analist / Data Scientist)
HTML:
Als Data Analytics Specialist / Data Analist / Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van data om inzichten te verkrijgen en te gebruiken voor datagedreven besluitvorming bij of voor onze gerenommerde klanten waaronder Belastingdienst, Gemeente Den Haag, diverse ministeries, Centraal Justitieel Incassobureau of VGZ. Afhankelijk van het ervaringsniveau ligt de focus op verschillende aspecten van data-analyse en data science.


Waarom past deze vacature bij jou?

Je bent analytisch, nieuwsgierig en gedreven om maatschappelijke impact te maken met data. Je schakelt gemakkelijk tussen techniek en beleid en weet abstracte analyses te vertalen naar concrete inzichten. Je draagt graag bij aan kennisdeling, continu verbeteren en datagedreven werken binnen onze klanten. Je vindt het leuk om kennis te delen met collega’s, klanten en vakgenoten. Je voelt je thuis in een informele, collegiale en professionele omgeving, waar de aandacht voor de klant en voor de medewerker centraal staan.

Wat ga je doen?

  • Verzamelen, opschonen, transformeren en valideren van data uit verschillende bronnen.
  • Toepassen van statistische methoden en data-analyse technieken om patronen, trends en inzichten uit data te halen.
  • Ontwikkelen van geavanceerde machine learning modellen.
  • Resultaten van analyses visualiseren en presenteren in heldere dashboards, rapporten en presentaties.
  • Adviseren over datagedreven besluitvorming aan management en stakeholders.
  • Coachen en (bege)leiden van medior en junior Data Specialisten.
  • Effectief samenwerken met Data Engineers, Data Stewards, business analisten en andere stakeholders.


Wat kun jij van ons verwachten?

  • Een vast dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000,- bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • Opdrachtkeuzevrijheid: Jij bepaalt in overleg waar je aan werkt, met de begeleiding van een personal coach;
  • Per jaar € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast ook nog eens 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met vakgenoten en inhoudelijke events;
  • Minimaal 25 vakantiedagen, met de mogelijkheid om extra dagen op te bouwen of te verkopen;
  • Sociale events zoals sportdagen, weekend weg en gezellige borrels;
  • Een vestiging bij jou in de buurt.


Jouw ontwikkeling, onze prioriteit

CIMSOLUTIONS biedt jou een omgeving waarin je kunt doorgroeien naar Data Architect / Data Consultant. Je krijgt ruimte, ondersteuning en middelen om je te specialiseren en te excelleren. We bieden toegang tot diverse opleidingen en ondersteunen je met ervaren collega's. Onze slogan "Learn, create and make it work" is niet zomaar een zin – het is de kern van hoe wij werken en ontwikkelen.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar o.a. leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • WO-diploma in een relevante richting.
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met het uitvoeren van data-analyses.
  • Diepgaande kennis van statistische methoden, machine learning technieken en algoritmen.
  • Ervaring met het ontwikkelen en trainen van machine learning modellen.
  • Ervaring met data-analyse tools en programmeertalen (bijv. Python of R).
  • Kennis van actuele ontwikkelingen op het gebied van data-analyse, data-ethiek en relevante wet- en regelgeving.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
  • Voor senior functies ervaring met het leiden van data science projecten en kennisdeling.
  • Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring, bij voorkeur in een Agile omgeving.


Waarom CIMSOLUTIONS?

15 keer Top Employer!

  • Uitstekend salaris;
  • Vrije keuze leaseauto;
  • € 5000,- opleidingsbudget;
  • Aantrekkelijke bonussen;
  • Veel sociale evenementen;
  • Uitdagende projecten;
  • Gevarieerde opdrachten;
  • Gerenommeerde klanten.


Heb je interesse?

Wij vinden het leuk om op ons hoofdkantoor of één van onze lokale vestigingen of online kennis te maken. Solliciteer via onderstaande button of neem voor meer informatie contact op met ons recruitment team via:

  • Mail: recruitment@cimsolutions.nl;
  • Telefoon: 0499-366 000;
  • of bezoek onze website: www.cimsolutions.nl/werken-bij/

Title: Freelance Data Scientist - Healthcare Experience
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist – Healthcare Experience

Location: North-Brabant, Netherlands (Hybrid: 3–4 Days/Week Onsite Ideally)

Type: Freelance

Duration: 12 Months




About the Role

We’re looking for a skilled Data Scientist with strong expertise in Python and a solid background in healthcare to join an expanding clinical-tech team in North Brabant. This hands-on role involves working with patient health data — particularly ECG and PPG signals — to develop advanced time-series algorithms and machine learning models that support ongoing digital health projects.




Key Responsibilities

Analyse and model physiological time-series data, including ECG, PPG and heart rate signals
Build and validate machine learning models for healthcare applications
Extract and preprocess relevant features from raw health data
Collaborate closely with clinical and engineering teams to drive project success
Support data quality and pipeline robustness
Potentially help upskill team members in the coming year




Requirements

Proven experience as a Data Scientist with a healthcare background (essential)
Strong proficiency in Python for data analysis and model development
Experience with signal processing and time-series analysis in healthcare data
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
Excellent communication and teamwork skills
Willingness to work in a hybrid environment (ideally 3–4 days per week onsite in North Brabant given that's what the rest of the team does)




If you wish to be considered for the position available, please e-mail an up to date CV with a contact number to: scott.combes@vividresourcing.com or alternatively call on +31 (0) 208888400. Please feel free to pass this advert on to other suitable candidates.

Title: AI/ML Engineer (Python)
Description:
Join Us to Drive Sustained Success through Innovation and Change! 🚀

At ValueBlue, we firmly believe that innovation and change are the lifeblood of progress. We aim to enable organizations to achieve long-term success by making innovation and change core to their strategies. We specialize in Enterprise Architecture, and our platform, BlueDolphin, simplifies the process, enabling companies to transform rapidly in the right direction.




We called ourselves the Architects of Change! That has to do with the fact we're in an industry that is used to describe problems and promote insights, not actually put the action hat and change things for good. We not only diagnose problems but engineer solutions that actively shape the world for the better.




We are currently recruiting for an AI/ML Engineer based in our Utrecht HQ!




The opportunity in short

We’re at an exciting inflection point: AI is expanding rapidly within ValueBlue, and we’re looking for someone to help take our AI-powered Solution Design tool from zero to one. The foundation is in place, the first set of AI features is live, and now we’re ready to go further — building an AI-first EA platform that serve people all over the globe.




As Part Of Our AI Chapter, You’ll

Contribute to existing AI features and evolve them further
Design and build entirely AI-driven new features
Analyze and fine-tune the system for quality and reliability
Take ownership of a key AI area after ramp-up
Collaborate across teams to drive an AI-first product vision




A strong candidate would fill most of the boxes below:

Building applications with LLMs
Taking ideas from zero to one — from prototype to production
Fluency in Python
Understanding how to scale and serve production systems
A product-oriented mindset with attention to user needs

These Would Give Your Profile An Extra Boost

A SaaS background
Previous experience as a developer
Exposure to digital transformation and/or change management (especially in the EA space)




Ready to shape the future with us? Click Apply and let’s build change together!

Title: Python AI Engineer
Description:
Role Overview




We’re looking for an AI Engineer with strong Python expertise to help design and deliver intelligent, scalable AI solutions across our healthcare systems. You'll work with cross-functional teams to develop ML models, implement data pipelines, and contribute to the deployment and monitoring of AI-powered features.




Key Responsibilities

Develop machine learning and deep learning models in Python using frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Write modular, testable, and production-ready Python code for data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model training.
Build and maintain scalable Python-based data pipelines using tools like Airflow and Pandas.
Deploy AI models in production using Python microservices and container technologies (e.g., Docker, FastAPI, Flask).
Collaborate with MLOps engineers to automate CI/CD pipelines for model training, testing, and deployment.
Implement monitoring, logging, and model performance tracking using Python tools and libraries.
Collaborate with data scientists to interpret data and ensure clinical relevance of AI solutions.
Adhere to software development best practices, version control (e.g., Git), and regulatory and quality standards.




Required Qualifications

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related technical field.
3+ years of professional experience in AI/ML development using Python.
Strong knowledge of the Python ecosystem for machine learning (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas, NumPy, FastAPI).
Experience deploying Python-based ML models in production environments (on cloud platforms like Azure or AWS).
Familiar with MLOps concepts, data versioning (DVC), and model lifecycle management using tools like MLflow or Weights & Biases.
Understanding of software testing in Python (e.g., pytest) and experience with performance optimization.

  • MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related technical field.
  • 3+ years of professional experience in AI/ML development using Python.
  • Strong knowledge of the Python ecosystem for machine learning (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas, NumPy, FastAPI).
  • Experience deploying Python-based ML models in production environments (on cloud platforms like Azure or AWS).
  • Familiar with MLOps concepts, data versioning (DVC), and model lifecycle management using tools like MLflow or Weights & Biases.
  • Understanding of software testing in Python (e.g., pytest) and experience with performance optimization.

Title: Freelance Data Scientist
Description:
Join a cross-functional team to develop and maintain machine learning solutions that drive customer satisfaction, operational efficiency, and personalized services.




Responsibilities

Build scalable, production-ready ML pipelines
Collaborate with domain experts to align models with business logic
Support roadmap execution and perform ad hoc analysis
Maintain code quality, testing, and monitoring standards
Work in an agile team focused on clarity, impact, and maintainability




Qualifications




3-5 years of experience
Knowledge in Python, PySpark, GitLab (CI/CD), MLflow, Databricks

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Working as Medior Data / AI Engineer at Atos

You will have the opportunity to work on complex and innovative projects, transforming the digital business of our (international) clients. We challenge you to bring your expertise and experience right at where you see possibilities to develop the digital business solutions of the future. Finally, we support you to develop yourself into the direction that best suits you, helping you to shape your career in digital.

Generative AI, real‑time streams and ever‑smarter LLMs are reshaping how businesses talk to their customers. As a Medior Data & AI Engineer you turn those breakthroughs into production solutions, take full ownership of the technical deliverables and guide junior engineers in the team. For example, we’re delivering a conversational LLM chatbot for a leading telecom provider. Depending on each client’s needs you’ll work with Azure AI Foundry, AWS Bedrock, Google Vertex or on‑prem AI stacks. Other projects span finance, retail and manufacturing, so you’ll keep discovering fresh domains and techniques alongside thirty enthusiastic architects, consultants and engineers who share knowledge and celebrate wins.

What we offer you


Tailored rewards package 29 vacation days, 8 % holiday allowance, a 13th-month salary and a performance-based bonus.
Flexible mobility budget spend it on public transport or a (shared) car or, whatever fits your lifestyle.
Continuous learning access to internal and external tech courses, certification tracks and a rich knowledge library.
Cutting-edge projects working with the newest Azure, AWS and Google Cloud technology to solve real-world business challenges.
Clear growth path; local and international career opportunities with mentoring from senior engineers and management.
Innovative peers; work alongside 30+ enthusiastic engineers, consultants and architects who love to share ideas and celebrate wins.
Work-life balance a hybrid setup with flexible remote options so you can work where it makes sense and keep life and work in harmony.



Your Skills, Capabilities, And Experience

Do you have


A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Data/AI Engineering or a related field?
2–5 years relevant experience with Python and solid cloud know‑how (Azure, AWS or GCP);
The ambition to earn recognised cloud & AI certificates and grow fast in multidisciplinary Scrum teams?
Strong analytical thinking, an independent mentality with ownership of deliverables, and ability to mentor junior colleagues while communicating clearly in both Dutch and English;
Flexibility to travel to clients when needed, balanced by hybrid working options the rest of the time?
Oral and written skills in Dutch and English;



Don’t hesitate and apply for Data / AI Engineer!

What’s next?


Successful Application
Great! You’ve filled out the application form and submitted your resume!
First Contact
One of our dedicated recruiters will reach out to you for a first online conversation to discusss your application and the match with Atos DTC
Interviews
After the first positive phone call, we will schedule (2) interviews with both colleagues from the team and your future manager
Offer
When we both feel it’s a match we’ll make you an offer
Welcome to the team!
Shape (y)our future as Data / AI Engineer
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

About Qogita

Qogita [Ko-gi-ta] is on a mission to keep retailers competitive by modernizing how wholesale procurement is done. The team is committed to building the rails to ensure small-businesses have the ability to acquire goods at competitive prices and at ease, so they can focus on creating great customer experiences.

We are one of the fastest growing B2B companies globally and are backed by top investors that have backed the likes of Facebook, Etsy, Shopify and others. Our team is small, highly motivated and focused on delivering impact.This organization is for individuals who appreciate challenging themselves and thrive on curiosity.

We operate with a flat organizational structure. All employees are expected to be hands-on and to contribute directly to the company's mission. Leadership is given to those who show initiative and consistently deliver excellence. Work ethic and strong prioritization skills are important.

Job Requirements

Who you are


You are based in the UK or NL
You are a passionate Data Scientist with at least 2 years of experience, who is able to extract impactful insights out of real-world datasets from different sources
You have a strong background in Python and relevant libraries (numpy, scipy, pandas, scikit-learn) as well as experience working with SQL and NoSQL databases
You have hands-on experience with traditional ML and LLM models for text and image data modelling or with commercial time series and business performance data. You know how to set up experiments and evaluation metrics.
You build reproducible analyses and services with git, Python virtual environments, and Docker containers.
You are someone who wants to thrive as a DS generalist that can support on difficult analytical business questions, modelling, as well as bringing your work into production.
You have a “get things done” attitude, and are able to push through obstacles by picking up the required skills from backend engineering, analytics, data engineering.
You like collaborating with commercial and product stakeholders and are able to suggest projects that solve real business problems. You attempt problems with the simplest possible solution first before diving into more complex approaches.
Experience with Django, AWS, mongoDB, Kafka, or integrating LLM APIs are a plus.


Job Responsibilities

What you'll be working on

As a Data Scientist, you will be part of one of our product squads. You will play a critical role in building Qogita’s offering and data backend. Your tasks can range from categorising product data, to developing a new way of pricing logistics cost, or analysing churn reasons.

Our data platform is build on airflow, dbt, snowflake, AWS S3, mongoDB, and Kafka.

Job Benefits

Package, Perks & Benefits


26 days of annual leave, plus 3 personal days to use whenever you need them
Yearly performance-based bonus to reward your impact
Pension contributions to help you plan for the future
Annual Learning & Development budget to support your professional growth
Hybrid working on a day-to-day basis, with the flexibility to work remotely for limited periods
Dog friendly offices
Onboarding home-office package to get you set up for success
Office socials and annual company-wide offsite to connect and celebrate with the team
Show more

Title: Data Analytics Specialist (Data Analist / Data Scientist)
HTML:
Als Data Analytics Specialist / Data Analist / Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van data om inzichten te verkrijgen en te gebruiken voor datagedreven besluitvorming bij of voor onze gerenommerde klanten waaronder Belastingdienst, Gemeente Den Haag, diverse ministeries, Centraal Justitieel Incassobureau of VGZ. Afhankelijk van het ervaringsniveau ligt de focus op verschillende aspecten van data-analyse en data science.


Waarom past deze vacature bij jou?

Je bent analytisch, nieuwsgierig en gedreven om maatschappelijke impact te maken met data. Je schakelt gemakkelijk tussen techniek en beleid en weet abstracte analyses te vertalen naar concrete inzichten. Je draagt graag bij aan kennisdeling, continu verbeteren en datagedreven werken binnen onze klanten. Je vindt het leuk om kennis te delen met collega’s, klanten en vakgenoten. Je voelt je thuis in een informele, collegiale en professionele omgeving, waar de aandacht voor de klant en voor de medewerker centraal staan.

Wat ga je doen?

  • Verzamelen, opschonen, transformeren en valideren van data uit verschillende bronnen.
  • Toepassen van statistische methoden en data-analyse technieken om patronen, trends en inzichten uit data te halen.
  • Ontwikkelen van geavanceerde machine learning modellen.
  • Resultaten van analyses visualiseren en presenteren in heldere dashboards, rapporten en presentaties.
  • Adviseren over datagedreven besluitvorming aan management en stakeholders.
  • Coachen en (bege)leiden van medior en junior Data Specialisten.
  • Effectief samenwerken met Data Engineers, Data Stewards, business analisten en andere stakeholders.


Wat kun jij van ons verwachten?

  • Een vast dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000,- bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • Opdrachtkeuzevrijheid: Jij bepaalt in overleg waar je aan werkt, met de begeleiding van een personal coach;
  • Per jaar € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast ook nog eens 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met vakgenoten en inhoudelijke events;
  • Minimaal 25 vakantiedagen, met de mogelijkheid om extra dagen op te bouwen of te verkopen;
  • Sociale events zoals sportdagen, weekend weg en gezellige borrels;
  • Een vestiging bij jou in de buurt.


Jouw ontwikkeling, onze prioriteit

CIMSOLUTIONS biedt jou een omgeving waarin je kunt doorgroeien naar Data Architect / Data Consultant. Je krijgt ruimte, ondersteuning en middelen om je te specialiseren en te excelleren. We bieden toegang tot diverse opleidingen en ondersteunen je met ervaren collega's. Onze slogan "Learn, create and make it work" is niet zomaar een zin – het is de kern van hoe wij werken en ontwikkelen.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar o.a. leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • WO-diploma in een relevante richting.
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met het uitvoeren van data-analyses.
  • Diepgaande kennis van statistische methoden, machine learning technieken en algoritmen.
  • Ervaring met het ontwikkelen en trainen van machine learning modellen.
  • Ervaring met data-analyse tools en programmeertalen (bijv. Python of R).
  • Kennis van actuele ontwikkelingen op het gebied van data-analyse, data-ethiek en relevante wet- en regelgeving.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
  • Voor senior functies ervaring met het leiden van data science projecten en kennisdeling.
  • Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring, bij voorkeur in een Agile omgeving.


Waarom CIMSOLUTIONS?

15 keer Top Employer!

  • Uitstekend salaris;
  • Vrije keuze leaseauto;
  • € 5000,- opleidingsbudget;
  • Aantrekkelijke bonussen;
  • Veel sociale evenementen;
  • Uitdagende projecten;
  • Gevarieerde opdrachten;
  • Gerenommeerde klanten.


Heb je interesse?

Wij vinden het leuk om op ons hoofdkantoor of één van onze lokale vestigingen of online kennis te maken. Solliciteer via onderstaande button of neem voor meer informatie contact op met ons recruitment team via:

  • Mail: recruitment@cimsolutions.nl;
  • Telefoon: 0499-366 000;
  • of bezoek onze website: www.cimsolutions.nl/werken-bij/

Title: AI engineer
Description:
Please note that we are only accepting candidates that live in or near the city of Amsterdam, The Netherlands. While we fully embrace remote work, we also value culture and connection - so our ideal candidate will be excited to come and join us at our studio at least once a week to share the energy and excitement of what we’re building together.

 

About Us

Huub is a platform that fully automates specific business processes by leveraging AI intelligently. We operate with a lean team of tech professionals and subject matter experts to develop and roll out these functionalities in the market. Are you looking for a place where you can work on concrete solutions for urgent problems while using bleeding-edge technology? Then Huub might be the right place for you.

 

Job Description

As an AI Engineer focusing on Prompt Engineering and Advanced AI Architecture, you will be responsible for designing, optimizing, and implementing AI solutions that enhance conversational and decision-making processes. You will improve AI-driven workflows by leveraging advanced AI agent architectures, efficient AI integrations, and prompt engineering.

You will work closely with other AI Engineers, platform architects, CI/CD teams, and UX specialists to ensure that our AI systems perform optimally, remain secure, and comply with best practices. You will contribute to the development of innovative methods to make AI interactions more effective, scalable, and intuitive.

 

Responsibilities

AI Architecture & Modeling

Integrate and optimize chat and reasoning models using LangChain, LangGraph, and LangSmith within AI workflows.
Design and develop AI agents with advanced context management and memory architectures.
Apply Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques to enhance information management.
Collaborate with infrastructure teams to build scalable and reliable AI solutions.

 

Prompt Engineering & Conversation Design

Develop and optimize prompts for various use cases within AI-driven processes.
Design and refine conversational flows and agent-based workflows within AI systems.
Implement safety guardrails and moderation strategies to ensure the reliability and ethical standards of AI interactions.

 

Requirements

Proven experience with cutting-edge AI technologies and methodologies.
A Master’s degree (WO) in AI, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
At least 3 years of experience in AI engineering, machine learning, or a similar technical role.
Experience in prompt engineering and conversation design for LLMs.
Deep knowledge of LangChain, LangGraph, and LangSmith.
Experience in designing robust AI agents and context-based workflows.
Understanding of AI ethics and moderation to build secure AI solutions.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills and a proactive mindset.




What We Offer

Huub operates as a lean tech startup, giving you the opportunity to build innovative AI solutions using cutting-edge technology. We offer a dynamic work environment where you have the freedom to develop your expertise and make an impact in a fast-growing AI ecosystem. We offer a competitive salary package with equity participation.




How to Apply

Send your CV and cover letter to vincent.lindeboom@huub.nl

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.

As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.

About Business Assurance

We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist, you play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data to inform business decisions. Your work will involve developing and deploying data-driven solutions, bringing them into production, and ensuring they continue to add value. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, design statistical models, and use your coding skills to extract meaningful insights from large datasets. This position allows you to be an internal entrepreneur within Business Assurance, building AI systems and team up in the broader AI community at DNV.

Engaging with process and product owners, understanding business workflows, data, and needs before shaping AI projects is essential to ensure the development of useful and impactful AI systems. Additionally, you will follow up on AI systems in production to ensure their adoption and ongoing value. Leveraging generative AI technologies, you will create innovative solutions that further enhance business capabilities.

Your Daily Activities Will Cover Following Areas


Data Collection and Preprocessing:
Collect and analyze business results or set up and manage new studies to gather relevant data.
Transform data into a suitable format for analysis.
Model Development and Deployment:
Build AI systems using generative AI technologies to create innovative solutions that enhance business capabilities.
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms.
Design and implement frameworks for data collection and automation.
Likewise, following up systems in production to make sure they are adopted and continue to add value.
Reporting and Communication:
Create reports, demonstrators and presentations outlining business predictions, proposals, and findings.
Communicate insights to stakeholders effectively.  It is important to create something tangible, that is “alive” to boost understanding and relevance.
Continuous Learning and Innovation:
Stay current with technical advancements, industry trends, and best practices.
Enable smarter business processes by using analytics for meaningful insights.
Explore and experiment with emerging generative AI tools and frameworks to drive innovation and maintain a competitive edge


What we offer


Career and development. The possibilities to grow and develop your competencies and ambitions within DNV are extensive. We have a strong company culture with emphasis on growth mindset, competence sharing and professional and personal development.
Work/life balance. We offer flexible working and have a focus on work/life balance for our employees.
Supportive and caring culture. Our international culture embodies diverse colleagues who value teamwork and inclusion across business areas and borders. You may also join employee associations to establish networks through social and professional activities. Our largest society CONNECT throws after-works and informal meetings all year long for you to join.
Attractive rewards. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, health services, and competitive pension, insurance, in addition to a global profit share scheme.
By joining DNV you become part of a world-leading company whose purpose is to safeguard life, property, and the environment. You will also be part of a culture where our values “we care, we share, we dare” characterize how we act towards each other, our customers and how we perform our work.


DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.

About You

To be successful in the role you should :


You hold a master’s degree or higher in data science, computer science, statistics or another related field
You have deep experience and knowledge with practical AI development for integration in business applications
You have strong experience in building and maintaining Python packages, including structuring, testing, and publishing reusable modules.
Experience with LLMs, prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).
You have working knowledge of git and docker
You are eager to learn about new technologies and trends
You enjoy working in cross-domain teams
You are result-oriented and like to solve problems
You are curious and eager to understand customer needs
You have good verbal and written communication skills in English

Please send us your CV and Cover Letter written in English.

Security and compliance with statutory requirements in the countries in which we operate is essential for DNV. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates as part of the offer process, in accordance with applicable country-specific laws and practices.

  • Create reports, demonstrators and presentations outlining business predictions, proposals, and findings.
  • Communicate insights to stakeholders effectively.  It is important to create something tangible, that is “alive” to boost understanding and relevance.
  • Continuous Learning and Innovation:
  • Stay current with technical advancements, industry trends, and best practices.
  • Enable smarter business processes by using analytics for meaningful insights.
  • Explore and experiment with emerging generative AI tools and frameworks to drive innovation and maintain a competitive edge

What we offer

  • Career and development. The possibilities to grow and develop your competencies and ambitions within DNV are extensive. We have a strong company culture with emphasis on growth mindset, competence sharing and professional and personal development.
  • Work/life balance. We offer flexible working and have a focus on work/life balance for our employees.
  • Supportive and caring culture. Our international culture embodies diverse colleagues who value teamwork and inclusion across business areas and borders. You may also join employee associations to establish networks through social and professional activities. Our largest society CONNECT throws after-works and informal meetings all year long for you to join.
  • Attractive rewards. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, health services, and competitive pension, insurance, in addition to a global profit share scheme.
  • By joining DNV you become part of a world-leading company whose purpose is to safeguard life, property, and the environment. You will also be part of a culture where our values “we care, we share, we dare” characterize how we act towards each other, our customers and how we perform our work.

DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.

About You

To be successful in the role you should :

  • You hold a master’s degree or higher in data science, computer science, statistics or another related field
    • You have deep experience and knowledge with practical AI development for integration in business applications
    • You have strong experience in building and maintaining Python packages, including structuring, testing, and publishing reusable modules.
    • Experience with LLMs, prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).
    • You have working knowledge of git and docker
    • You are eager to learn about new technologies and trends
    • You enjoy working in cross-domain teams
    • You are result-oriented and like to solve problems
    • You are curious and eager to understand customer needs
    • You have good verbal and written communication skills in English
Please send us your CV and Cover Letter written in English.

Security and compliance with statutory requirements in the countries in which we operate is essential for DNV. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates as part of the offer process, in accordance with applicable country-specific laws and practices.

Title: AI Specialist
Description:
Ben jij degene die kansen ziet om werkprocessen slimmer in te richten en weet hoe je dat aanpakt? Snap je hoe je saaie, herhalende klusjes omtovert tot smooth workflows met tools als Zapier, Make, Power Automate en n8n? En ben je ook thuis in AI-tools zoals ChatGPT, Copilot, Perplexity en Gemini? Dan zoeken wij jou om ons AI-team te versterken!


Taken


Als AI specialist help je lokale bedrijven ontdekken wat AI voor hen kan betekenen, en zet je ideeën om in werkende oplossingen. Je gaat:





Slimme processen bouwen en automatiseren bij verschillende ondernemers (ja, lekker afwisselend en op locatie).


Actief, samen met het bedrijf, naar laaghangend fruit zoeken waar AI direct iets kan betekenen.


Niet alleen techniek, maar juist de mensen meenemen in verandering (want dat vinden wij minstens zo belangrijk).


Meehelpen om de tofste scale-up in Almkerk nóg beter te maken.


Gewoon lekker samenwerken, niet de hele dag thuis achter je scherm.



Vereisten


Wie ben jij?

Je bent praktisch met passie voor techniek en innovatie. Je snapt bedrijfsprocessen en je stroopt samen met klanten de mouwen op. Je denkt mee, vraagt door en maakt dingen echt.




Wat je in elk geval moet kunnen:





Processen analyseren en structureren om vervolgens te automatiseren.


Makkelijk schakelen tussen klantvraag en technische oplossingen.


Goed kunt uitleggen wat AI is, ook aan mensen zonder technische achtergrond.


Je bent zelfstandig, maar je zoekt ook zeker de samenwerking op.


Actief werken met LLM’s (zoals OpenAI, Anthropic, of andere bestaande modellen).





Bonuspunten als je:





Verder kijkt dan alleen ChatGPT en ervaring hebt met andere LLM’s.


Al eens gewerkt hebt aan automatiseringsoplossingen voor bedrijven


Weet hoe je eigen modellen kunt trainen en finetunen.



Benefits



Een energiek team van bijna 20 collega’s die net zo enthousiast zijn als jij.


Werken voor gave klanten met uitdagende projecten.


Veel kansen om te leren, te groeien en jezelf te ontwikkelen.


Prima arbeidsvoorwaarden (maar dat vind je logisch, toch?).





Stuur je cv en een korte video waarin je jezelf voorstelt. Niet verplicht, wel leuk. Geen regisseur nodig, geen script, gewoon wie jij bent. Past dit niet bij je? Dan mag je natuurlijk ook gewoon iets anders insturen. Zolang het maar écht van jou is, niet van ChatGPT of een andere LLM😉

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior data scientist - AI for healthcare

Are you an experienced Data Scientist who wants to apply your expertise in AI to improve the quality of life of vulnerable people? Then join us at Mentech to work on our groundbreaking products Hume and Noa!




About Mentech

Mentech is a high-tech company based in Eindhoven, driven by the mission to improve the quality of life of vulnerable individuals. Every day, our dedicated team of hardware designers, data scientists, software developers, behavioral experts, and consultants works on groundbreaking innovations at the intersection of technology and care.




People with intellectual disabilities or dementia often struggle to express emotions, pain, or discomfort. This can lead to stress, behavioral challenges, and difficulties for caregivers in providing the right support.




At Mentech, we develop innovative AI-driven solutions to make emotions and stress visible, prevent loneliness, and improve the quality of care.

Hume is our emotion recognition platform, using wearable sensors, behavioral models, and machine learning to detect stress from physiological signals (heart rate, skin conductance, movement). It helps caregivers better understand clients and provide meaningful care.
Noa is our AI assistant for long-term care, designed to support caregivers and clients with intelligent interventions, such as reducing overstimulation or preventing loneliness through personalized interaction.

Together, Hume and Noa shape the future of compassionate and data-driven healthcare.




Job description

As a Data Scientist at Mentech, you will join a multidisciplinary team of data scientists, software engineers, and healthcare experts. You will design, develop, and validate AI and algorithms that directly impact mental well-being and quality of life. You will work on diverse projects ranging from physiological signal processing to behavioral modeling and AI-driven interventions.




Main responsibilities

Develop and optimize neural networks and machine learning models for stress recognition, emotion detection, and behavioral prediction.
Work with multimodal data sources (wearables, sensors, contextual data, interaction logs).
Contribute to the development of Noa’s AI-driven intervention engine and Hume’s stress detection models.
Perform data preprocessing, feature extraction, and model validation with a strong focus on reliability and clinical relevance.
Collaborate with electrical engineers, software developers, and healthcare professionals to translate real-world needs into technical solutions.
Stay at the forefront of AI advancements in mental health and emotion recognition.
Take ownership of subprojects and contribute to the long-term AI roadmap.




Your profile

MSc or PhD in Data Science, AI, Cognitive Neuroscience, Biomedical Engineering, or related field.
5+ years of experience in developing and deploying AI models, preferably in healthcare or life sciences.
Strong programming skills in Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow/PyTorch, SciPy).
Experience with guardrails and LLM personalization.
Familiarity with version control (Git) and cloud environments (AWS preferred).
Experience with Agile development is a plus.
Strong analytical mindset and customer-focused problem-solving skills.
Team player with excellent communication skills.
Passion for improving the lives of vulnerable people.




What we offer

Competitive salary aligned with your experience.
Flexible work arrangements, including hybrid options.
30 days of paid leave per year, based on fulltime employment
Time, budget and guidance for professional development
A multidisciplinary and international team of +-25 professionals.
Direct collaboration with care institutions and universities.
Opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth.
A chance to make real-world impact by developing AI that improves quality of life.




Interested?

Would you like to contribute to meaningful innovation in healthcare? Do you want to help shape the future of AI in care with Hume and Noa?

Apply now for the position of Senior Data Scientist at Mentech!




This position is primarily on-site at our Eindhoven office, with some hybrid flexibility. We therefore welcome applicants who are already based in or around Eindhoven. We are not working with external recruitment agencies for this vacancy.

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
Senior AI Research Engineer




Innovation – Nijmegen, Gelderland (Hybrid)




SciPro is exclusively partnered with a pioneering medical imaging innovator seeking a Senior AI Research Engineer to revolutionize cancer detection through advanced AI technologies. This opportunity offers the chance to drive meaningful healthcare impact in a cutting-edge environment.




You'll develop sophisticated AI solutions—including foundation models, vision transformers, multimodal systems, and large language models—to tackle critical breast cancer diagnostic challenges. Working alongside clinical experts, you'll transform groundbreaking research into solutions that directly improve patient outcomes.




Key Responsibilities:




• Architect next-generation AI models that enhance cancer detection accuracy

• Apply deep learning and self-supervised methodologies to complex medical imaging datasets

• Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to translate AI research into clinical applications

• Mentor junior team members and foster knowledge sharing across the organization




Your Qualifications:




• Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related field

• 4+ years building AI applications in radiology using large-scale datasets and GPU clusters

• Proven expertise in neural networks, self-supervised learning, and medical imaging AI

• Strong Python skills with experience in PyTorch, TensorBoard, and Slurm frameworks




Submit your application today to join this mission-driven team making life-changing impact through AI innovation.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Do you want to shape the future of AI in horticulture? At Mprise Agriware, you’ll get the chance to turn cutting-edge AI into real-world solutions that help growers worldwide. As an AI Engineer, you’ll be part of a small, agile team dedicated to translating AI into practical, real-world solutions for our customers.




What will you do?

In this role, you'll be developing and testing innovative AI solutions that push our products—and our customers—forward. You’ll bring ideas to life through prototypes, proof of concepts (POCs), and MVPs, turning technological trends into tangible applications. You’ll work closely with colleagues from various disciplines, in a small innovation team where there’s plenty of room for initiative and personal input.




You will be responsible for:

Developing and testing AI concepts through POCs and MVPs
Translating new technologies into working AI applications for our customers
Building agents, prompts, and AI workflows based on experimentation and short iterations
Integrating AI solutions into existing software, in collaboration with product teams and domain experts
Validating ideas and assumptions through hypotheses, testing, and feedback loops
Documenting and sharing insights, reusable components, and lessons learned
Actively contributing to innovation projects, hackathons, and AI initiatives
Applying and sharing your AI knowledge within the organization




You make sure innovation doesn’t remain an idea. It becomes reality, adding real value for our users.




What are we looking for?

We’re looking for a curious and enterprising AI Engineer who uses technology to create meaningful impact. You enjoy experimenting, learning quickly, and turning ideas into real, working solutions. You’re comfortable working independently and collaboratively, and you love building something new with others.




You recognize yourself in the following:

Bachelor’s degree (HBO+) or equivalent working and thinking level
Strong command of English (Dutch is a plus)
Affinity with building Agentic AI Workflows & Generative AI Features
Experience with or interest in Microsoft Azure tools like AI Foundry, Copilot Studio and more
Familiarity with development languages such as Python, and preferably Microsoft integration tools
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
An experimental mindset: hypothesis → test → learn → improve
Strong communication skills (verbal and written); you're able to clearly explain your ideas
You stay up to date with the latest AI trends and enjoy sharing your knowledge




We're looking for someone with a broad interest in AI technologies, ready to explore and grow with us in a fast-evolving field.




About Mprise Agriware

At Mprise Agriware, we’re driven by progress. With our Agriware 365 software, we help the global horticultural sector work smarter, more efficiently, and more sustainably. Our clients include seed breeders, plant growers, and young plant producers around the world. We combine deep industry knowledge with modern Microsoft technologies to support their growth and innovation.




What do we offer?

At Mprise Agriware, you’ll join a group of around 100 Sharp Minds, both in the Netherlands and internationally. Though we operate on a global scale, we value close connections. We help and respect each other—not just as colleagues, but as people. From day one, you’ll be seen as a full-fledged member of the team. In your area of expertise, you are the expert—and we’ll support you to keep growing through continuous learning and development.




Colleagues who care for each other—that’s just how we do things
Continuous learning through Mprise Academy, training budget, and education support
Growth opportunities in a dynamic, growing company
Quarterly team days focused on collaboration and knowledge sharing
A ping-pong table, fresh fruit, and a great workspace in Veenendaal
Remote work allowance and a budget for setting up your home office
Competitive salary based on your skills and experience
Laptop and phone reimbursement
Mobility allowance or lease car
27 vacation days and a solid pension plan
Regular events and fun get-togethers




Interested?

Excited to apply your AI expertise in a role that blends innovation, collaboration, and impact? Send your application to careers@mprise-agriware.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

Do you have any questions about the role? Feel free to contact:

📞 Freija Elings: +31 6 4378 7471

📞 Bianca Buurman: +31 6 3911 1483

Show more

Title: Data Science Associate
Description:
Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working
Be part of a fast-growing company that helps businesses leverage data analytics for better decision-making.
Collaborate with a highly skilled, dynamic, and supportive team.
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning in analytics and consulting.
Competitive salary and benefits package, including training, mentorship, and travel opportunities.



What you will do


Conduct analyses using advanced analytical tools such as Python, R, SQL, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations and interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Looker.
Solve complex problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses, and create actionable recommendations from data and analysis.
Prepare and facilitate workshops and training sessions for clients and team members.
Manage stakeholders and communicate effectively with executives.
Coach and mentor junior team members, fostering their growth and development.



What you’ll bring


3+ years of professional work experience in the analytics domain.
An advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
Ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses, and derive recommendations from data analysis.
Strong technical skills in data analysis, machine learning, and programming. Proficiency in Python, SQL, R, and cloud computing platforms.
Experience with Python data tools (e.g., Jupyter, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Ability to communicate complex statistical and analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent command of the English language.
Experience in consulting is a plus.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

  • Ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses, and derive recommendations from data analysis.
  • Strong technical skills in data analysis, machine learning, and programming. Proficiency in Python, SQL, R, and cloud computing platforms.
  • Experience with Python data tools (e.g., Jupyter, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Ability to communicate complex statistical and analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Excellent command of the English language.
  • Experience in consulting is a plus.


In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (L5) - Studio Metrics & Strategy DSE - EMEA
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 300 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

The Studio Metrics & Strategy DSE team leverages data to empower our business partners in the Content Operations & Innovation organization to measure, interrogate, and steer Content Operations with precision and clarity. This facilitates operational excellence in content production, enabling creative teams to produce the best movies and shows that we know members will love.

EMEA is a growing center for our broader Content Production & Promotion teams. We are looking for a stunning Senior Data Scientist based in Amsterdam to join our growing EMEA team. In this role, you will partner with Content Operations & Innovation and Product teams to empower how we produce the best content efficiently and effectively. Through thoughtful metric design and causal inference modeling, you will have the opportunity to directly influence decision-making around how we produce and innovate on global content production.

As a Senior Data Scientist in this space, you will:


Be the first Applied Inference Data Scientist in the Studio Production Data Science & Engineering org
Be a strategic thought partner for Content & Business Product PMs and Content Operations & Innovation leaders and teams, identifying metric and analytic opportunities to assess and enhance business health
Advance content operations efficiency through the effective identification and application of analytics and causal inference methods
Drive the direction of your work, including leading the design, analysis, and interpretation of causal research
Present your research and findings to both technical and non-technical business and product partners
Establish and maintain strong partnerships with a variety of business and product stakeholders, working directly with them to introduce and influence data-informed ways of working
Work with other outstanding Data Scientists and Analytics Engineers, in-region and globally, to explore our wealth of operational data and uncover insights that enable Netflix to produce even better shows and movies for our members
Become a regional expert on all things Studio Data Science & Engineering, helping educate and connect regional offices to existing research data solutions from across the team


About You


Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, or related quantitative field
5+ years of relevant experience with a variety of causal inference methods, including quasi-experimental designs and managing complexities around smaller sample sizes
Strong statistical knowledge and intuition, ideally utilized in experimentation or observational causal analysis settings
An expert in SQL and Python
Proven track record wrangling data, performing exploratory data analysis, designing metrics and tests, building causal inference solutions, and articulating data stories to deliver meaningful business impact
Strong verbal and written communicator who can develop and deepen effective relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders and communicate technical concepts clearly and concisely to less technical audiences
A self-starter with a learning mindset who is exceptionally curious – eagerly diving into new spaces and bringing informed ideas to the table
Comfortable operating in ambiguity and a fast-paced environment; able to take ownership and thrive with minimal oversight and process
Thrilled about innovating in the Content Production domain via novel experimental techniques and comfortable taking (smart) risks in your work
Extensive experience within the EMEA region, adept at working across different cultures on a globally-distributed team, collaborating with fellow team members and partners to ideate on and deliver impactful research
Netflix culture resonates with you
Plus: Experience creating data products and dashboards such as Tableau
Plus: Experience building applied machine learning models with demonstrated business impact


You will have the opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way, working alongside smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems, and influence decision-making in a fast-paced, exciting environment. You can learn more about our culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture.

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer – 6+ Months – Breda/Hybrid




Are you an AI Engineer with a passion for innovation, high-performance computing, and AI infrastructure? Do you enjoy building solutions from scratch in a fast-paced, exploratory environment? We're working with a forward-thinking organization in Breda that is embarking on an exciting new journey, developing an on-prem AI platform to support custom language model development for specialized ICT programs.




The Opportunity:

This is a greenfield project where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the architecture, environment setup, and tooling required to run and test LLMs (Large Language Models) on custom hardware in the client's private data center. The goal is to remove all barriers to experimentation, enabling instant testing and iteration with AI models on-premises.

You'll be responsible for researching, designing, and delivering the foundational environment and infrastructure, including tooling such as AutoShell AI, Jupyter, and high-performance computing (HPC) frameworks.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and deliver AI-ready cloud/on-prem environments tailored to language model experimentation
Set up and manage a secure and scalable HPC infrastructure in the client's datacenter
Build automated pipelines and tooling to enable fast, repeatable LLM testing
Research and evaluate techniques and tools (LLM frameworks, GPU utilization, etc.)
Integrate platforms like Jupyter for experimentation and visualization
Work closely with ICT stakeholders to ensure infrastructure meets their model and hardware needs
Define future architecture for on-prem AI capabilities with long-term scalability in mind




Key Skills and Experience:

Proven experience in cloud or on-prem infrastructure engineering for AI/ML applications
Experience with LLMs, AI tooling, and language model deployment workflows
Strong skills in Python, Shell scripting, and environmental automation
Familiarity with AutoShell AI, Jupyter, or similar AI toolchains (or willingness to ramp up quickly)
Background in high-performance computing (HPC) or GPU-intensive workloads
Understanding of hybrid environments, custom hardware integration, and data center operations
Ability to work independently and explore emerging AI infrastructure techniques




We aim to respond promptly to all applications. However, due to high volumes, there may be times when we cannot reply to every applicant. Thank you for your understanding.




Amoria Bond operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

Show more
