Title: Fullstack Software Engineer I
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Trustpilot, we're on an incredible journey. We're a profitable, high-growth FTSE-250 company with a big vision: to become the universal symbol of trust. We run the world's largest independent consumer review platform, and while we've come a long way, there's still so much exciting work to do. Come join us at the heart of trust!

We are growing our engineering teams at Trustpilot and are looking to invite Fullstack Software Engineers to join our B2B Integrations team!

The Integrations team's mission is to empower businesses of all sizes, from sole traders to global enterprises, to seamlessly incorporate Trustpilot into their customer feedback workflows and tools. We aim to provide highly reliable and user-friendly integrations for popular platforms, including Shopify, HubSpot, Salesforce, and Meta (Facebook/Instagram). By joining our team, you'll manage the challenge of creating a unified event-driven architecture to support these diverse integrations, and gain the opportunity to work with a variety of software platforms and coding languages.

You will join a cross-functional team with full ownership of our products and codebase, where you will take part in every step of the development process, from ideation to maintenance. A place where you can grow as an individual, while also having an influence on the direction of projects and technological choices.

What You’ll Be Doing


Work in a cross-functional “full ownership” team alongside Product, Design, and Data teams where you will take part in every step of the process of building, from ideation and design to architecture, code, deployment, and maintenance
Collaborate with decision-making and in design discussions during the development
Help with planning, implementation, and release of new features
Troubleshoot existing software
Inspire and challenge the organization with your knowledge of how to solve problems
Expand a data-driven mindset by analysing, gathering, and aggregating data to support decisions, both technical and non-technical
Seek support & guidance from senior engineers & your manager to help grow your skills and your career


Who You Are


Customer-centric, and has a solution-oriented mindset with a bias for action
Ambitious and enthusiastic about your work. You constantly look to raise the bar for yourself and those around you in everything you do
Has a desire to solve problems. You are committed to finding solutions, exploring all avenues, and reaching out for help when needed
Values the importance of diverse perspectives within teams
Has a friendly and accommodating personality, open to giving and receiving feedback in a constructive way
Keen to collaborate across the full web development stack
Interested in building skills in Cloud-based development, specifically with serverless architecture, data pipelines, and event-driven systems
Has experience in back-end technologies like Node.js and component-based front-end development using React
Interested in developing RESTful APIs and distributed cloud services
Has experience with feature development and deploying software to production
Exposure to or interest in: AWS and event-driven architecture, ecommerce app development (Shopify, Prestashop etc.), CRM integrations (Hubspot, Zendesk etc.), Salesforce, and PHP or other web development scripting languages


The technologies and services that we would help you to learn to excel in this role"


Infrastructure: AWS (ECS, Lambda, SNS, SQS, CloudFormation, ...), Docker
Languages: Typescript, Javascript
Frontend: React, SSR, CSS Modules, Sass, CSS-in-JS (Emotion, Styled Components)
Database: DynamoDB, PostgreSQL, BigQuery
DevOps Tools: NewRelic, GitHub, Kibana
Find more on: http://stackshare.io/trustpilot


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Randers SV, DK, 8940)
Description:
14/08/2025

Group CFO

DNK-Randers, Danish Crown Vej

Data Scientist

Do you believe there’s a connection between bacon and data? Do you want to be part of a team whose mission is to turn data into delicious insights?

At Danish Crown, we believe that just as bacon is a key product in our portfolio, data is the essential ingredient that drives our innovation and success, helping us to optimize processes, predict trends, and maintain our leadership in the industry – and we’re now looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team and help us in this journey ahead of us.

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at Danish Crown, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets to uncover valuable insights, developing predictive models, and working closely with cross-functional teams to drive data-informed decision-making. You will be involved in various projects, such as:


Commodity, livestock, and product forecasting.
Object detection and tracking in real-time video feeds from production sites.


Success starts with a team

You will become part of the Data Science team within the Data, Analytics & AI space in the Global IT department. We work on multiple initiatives for various business units, with tasks around delivering data analysis and insights, modelling of complex data sources, and research and implementation of machine learning and deep learning models for tasks such as time-series forecasting, image recognition, or natural language processing, amongst others.

We are curious about the latest developments in our space, and therefore actively encourage everyone to have an innovative mindset and propose their ideas for further incubation.

Key Responsibilities

You’ll be part of helping Danish Crown become a data-first organization. Your main tasks will include:


Providing actionable insights, identify trends and measure performance by conducting advanced statistical and other analyses.
Developing analytical solutions by creating, testing and implementing complex models and algorithms.
Implementing scalable, sustainable solutions addressing business needs in collaboration with AI/ML and Data Engineers.
Explaining the design, functioning and output of analytical models/solutions to consumers.
Staying up to date with the latest trends and advancements in data science and machine learning.


Who are we looking for?

A passionate and detail-oriented colleague with a knack for uncovering insights from data, thriving in a collaborative environment and always eager to learn and apply new technologies.

With a strong analytical mindset, you enjoy solving complex problems and your excellent communication skills allow you to effectively convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role.
Strong programming skills in Python. SQL is a plus.
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.
Fluent in English. Understanding of Danish can be a plus.
Familiar with cloud platforms and version control.


Appetite For More?

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Manager, Data Science Global IT, Francesc Joan Riera at (+45) 60 90 67 72.

We review candidates continuously, so let us know why you are the right candidate for the job and send it together with your CV. We aim for a start, as soon as possible – will wait for the right person.

We are a food company owned by Danish farmers supplying high-quality food to customers and consumers worldwide. From butchers to business developers, we're more than 24,000 colleagues, all committed to lowering our carbon footprint and becoming climate-neutral by 2050 for better food and a brighter future.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models to meet project-specific guidelines.
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
Ensuring clarity, consistency, and factual accuracy.
Providing feedback to writers and working with QA Specialists to uphold quality


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
Experience with Cloud sourcing platform is a plus
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: AI Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hvis du får helt kriller i fingrene af muligheden for at arbejde med AI - og er OpenAI (måske) so last year for dig 🥱

Så er du landet på den helt rette jobannonce 🙌




Vi søger en dygtig og engageret AI-udvikler, der brænder for at optimere processer gennem data, automatisering og avanceret teknologi. Hos os får du din egen stol og skrivebord på vores kontor i Carlsberg Byen. Du vil blive en del af et nyt AI team i Customer Success. Du kan naturligvis ikke gøre det hele alene, så du vil skulle arbejde tæt sammen med vores andre AI udviklere i vores Product Development afdeling 🙌




Dét kan jeg godt se mig selv blive en del af - men hvad skal jeg lave?

Du vil få en central rolle i at udvikle og implementere AI-løsninger, der effektiviserer vores interne forretningsgange – blandt andet inden for dataopsamling, voice-based assistenter og intelligent procesautomatisering. Det kunne være via OpenAI, men det kan også være, at du er større fan af en anden, lignende teknologi - og så ruller vi med den i stedet. Du er eksperten 🎈

Vi ser AI som et must i vores fremtidige løsninger. I det hele taget bliver din opgave at være med til at finde ud af, hvordan vi kan gøre brug af AI i vores virksomhed på bedst mulig vis. Det er ærligt ikke en særlig konkret jobbeskrivelse. Det ved vi, men det er et udtryk for, at du her får en ren tavle og AI-legeplads at arbejde med 🛝




Hvad er højest på vores ønskeliste?

🐈 ⬛ Du har leget eller arbejdet med AI-teknologier og ved, hvordan man får dem til at spinde

🐍 Du ved, at Python ikke kun er en slangeart. Om du kan tæmme slangearten, er ikke så vigtigt, men vi håber, at du kan tæmme den anden variant.

🌟 Du kan ikke lade være med konstant at følge med og udforske, hvordan AI kan gøre ting smartere




Hvis du også har erfaring på tastaturet med C# og Azure, kan vi ikke få armene ned af bare begejstring 🙌

Det er næppe verdens længste ønskeliste, men vi er trætte af det klassiske jobopslag, der næsten ikke er andet end krav til dig. Vi kunne aldrig drømme om at skrive, at vi forventer, at du har x-års erfaring. Det siger jo ingenting om dine kompetencer 🤷 ♀️




Vi vil ikke love dig guld og grønne skove, men:

Hos os er der plads til dig, som du er. Måske er du gladest i din Copenhell-hoodie eller i en hvid skjorte. Måske er du en ægte vin connaisseur 🍷, måske er du mest bare til pepsi eller cola🥤 (som vi iøvrigt har et helt køleskab af på kontoret).

Uanset hvad skal der være plads til dig som menneske og også til det, der giver dig energi uden for arbejdet. Derfor tilbyder vi alle vores medarbejdere op til 7 ugers betalt frihed om året(!) Derudover kan vi love dig en kollegial arbejdsplads med frokostordning, sundheds- og tandforsikring, god kaffe ☕️ og naturligvis muligheden for hjemmearbejde.




Interesseret?

Hvis du kan se dig selv i rollen, vil vi meget gerne høre fra dig. Vi ved godt, at AI stadig er et område i udvikling – og derfor lægger vi ikke vægt på diplomer eller mange års erfaring.

Vi er ikke ude efter en traditionel ansøgning og CV 📄

Vi har lavet fire spørgsmål, som du skal besvare, og hvis du har lyst vil vi gerne se eksempler på noget du allerede har lavet👌Det kan være små projekter, kodeeksempler, en video eller noget helt andet – vælg det format, der giver bedst mening for dig.

Du er også velkommen til at skrive et par ord om, hvorfor du er interesseret i stillingen – men det er helt op til dig ✌️

Vi vil gerne kunne sige velkommen til vores kommende kollega 1. november 2025, så smid din billet i puljen. The sooner the better 🥳 Vi lover, at vi ikke lader dig hænge for længe i uvished!

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Customer Success Manager Lene Bech på lene.bech@visma.com.

For spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen kan du kontakte Inja Nielsen på inja.nielsen@visma.com.




Hvem er Visma DataLøn og ProLøn?

Visma DataLøn og ProLøn er eksperter i løn og HR. Sammen skaber vi en enklere hverdag for vores 65.000 kunder, som vi bl.a. producerer over 500.000 lønsedler for om måneden. Vi er en del af Visma-koncernen, som er Skandinaviens førende leverandør af løn- og HR-systemer... og sponsor af verdens bedste cykelhold🚴

Show more

Title: Freelance AI Agent Assistant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

If you're a professional who works with AI Data Annotation and friendly user of LLMs, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your editing, annotating, fact-checking and creative skills to an AI training project.

This is a freelance role for a project, and your typical tasks may include:


Conduct high-quality web searches to verify facts, gather supporting data, and cross-check AI responses.
Perform fact-checking and intent verification to ensure AI responses align with the user's goals.
Carefully review and flag any inaccuracies, inconsistencies, or irrelevant answers.
Provide structured feedback on AI-generated content to help improve model performance.
Work effectively with large language models (LLMs), understanding their capabilities and limitations, and applying best practices when interacting with them
Prompt generation with a purpose to receive the best quality result of LLMs


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher
You have professional and/or educational experience in data annotation, demonstrate a deeper-than-user-level interest in AI, and possess intellectual breadth and curiosity
You are skilled in web searching, fact-checking, intent-checking, able to work with LLMs and have great attention to detail
Your level of English is upper-intermediate (B2) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
🚀 We're Hiring: MLOps Engineer | Copenhagen | Hybrid Work

Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)




Are you passionate about building reliable, scalable platforms for machine learning? We’re looking for an experienced IT Platform Engineer to help shape and support a cutting-edge MLOps environment that powers real-time model deployment and scoring across critical domains, including fraud detection and online payments.




🌍 The Role

Join a collaborative squad focused on delivering a future-proof MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You'll take ownership of automating model life cycles—from development to deployment—and build CI/CD workflows, infrastructure as code, and robust ML pipelines that scale with enterprise needs.




🔧 Tech You’ll Use

Cloud: AWS (extensive use), Databricks
Languages: Python, PySpark
Infra: Terraform, Docker, GitHub Actions
Tools: MLflow for model tracking/versioning, container orchestration
Bonus: Experience with Kafka or Pub/Sub streaming is a big plus!




🎯 What You’ll Be Doing

Develop and maintain automated pipelines for ML model training, validation, and inference
Build CI/CD workflows that seamlessly move models into production
Containerize ML workloads and manage infrastructure using best-in-class tools
Collaborate in an agile setup




👤 About You

You bring at least 2 years of hands-on experience in MLOps, solid cloud knowledge, strong Python and infrastructure-as-code skills, and an eye for performance and reliability. You’re a proactive problem-solver, a team player, and passionate about scaling ML in production.




💼 What’s In It for You

A human-centred, inclusive work culture
Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)
Flexible hybrid working setup
Access to development programs and professional certifications
Comprehensive health, insurance, and well-being benefits
A competitive compensation package and extra leave options




📍Location: Copenhagen

📅 Apply now and help us transform how machine learning supports real-world impact.

#MLOps #Python #AWS #Databricks #Terraform #CI/CD #MachineLearning #TechJobs #CopenhagenJobs #HiringNow #CloudEngineering

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Predictive AI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 30617

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to explore and develop machine learning models in financial crime prevention. The role is permanent and can be based in Denmark, Finland and Sweden.

About Our Team

Meet the AI & Machine Learning team. Our role is to improve how we detect and investigate financial crime with the help of AI and machine learning, to keep our customers, Nordea and society safe.

Our team is about 25 people working out of Stockholm, Helsinki and Copenhagen as a part of the group financial crime prevention (GFCP) unit that provides financial crime prevention services to all of the bank.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us. 

Main responsibilities in this role:


Prototype and explore the feasibility of new AI use cases in collaboration with business stakeholders
Implement, deploy, and monitor our AI applications
Rigorously evaluate and improve the quality of our AI applications


Who You Are

We believe that you're an energetic individual who enjoys bringing ideas, exploring their potential, and presenting the results. You're passionate about building machine learning models that can identify complex financial crimes, ensuring both the bank’s and society's safety. No need for any prior experience in banking or finance.

Your background and skills include:


MSc or PhD in a filed related to predictive or statistical modelling
At least four years work experience fully dedicated to predictive machine learning model development
A knack for tackling complex problems and creating understandable and robust solutions
Strong communication and presentation skills, explaining complex ideas to different stakeholders


What We Offer

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 08/09/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Peter Nödtveidt, Head of Predictive AI in FCIIA, at peter.nodtveidt@nordea.com.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Only for candidates in Finland: A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
Show more

Submit your application no later than 08/09/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Peter Nödtveidt, Head of Predictive AI in FCIIA, at peter.nodtveidt@nordea.com.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Only for candidates in Finland: A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

Title: Research Scientist
Place: Ølstykke, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Research Scientist with CVD experience

Are you passionate about development of novel treatments of cardiovascular disease (CVD) and have experience working with large animal models within this field? Then you have the option to join a fast-growing scientifically-driven CRO as Minerva Imaging is now offering a unique job opportunity. We are looking for an experienced Research Scientist to join our large animal pharmacology team where we are dedicated to developing the medicines of tomorrow.




The position:

As a Research Scientist focused on CVD in the large animal pharmacology team you will be responsible for conducting pre-clinical in vivo pharmacology studies. These will include advanced surgical model induction, state-of-the-art medical imaging and biomarker endpoints which are directly translatable to the clinic. Therefore, you must have a good understanding of the disease models used within CVD research and preferably have hands-on experience with these. The ability to design and interpret in vivo pharmacology data is also crucial. The ideal candidate is structured and can handle many tasks and stakeholders at a time. You must have a dedicated and persistent attitude with an aim to succeed and deliver high-quality data.




Your key responsibilities will include:

Designing and conducting large animal in vivo pharmacology studies with in the CVD area in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders
Execution and implementation of surgically induced disease models
Molecular imaging of large animals like MRI, PET and SPECT/CT
Participation in coordination tasks within the department and with other research areas of Minerva Imaging to ensure successfully executed studies
Communication with external stakeholders (customers) orally and in writing
Optimization of current methods and procedures with your passion for high-quality data
Analyzing, interpreting, and reporting study results




Qualifications:

To succeed in the position, you should have

A life science background at minimum Master level e.g., biology, veterinary science, or (molecular) biomedicine
Some years of experience with in vivo pharmacology studies in large animals
Experience working with pre-clinical CVD models
Surgical experience in large animals is an advantage
Experience with study conduction / project management
Experience with medical imaging techniques is an advantage
Flair for - and interest in - customer contact
Highly collaborative skills since all projects rely heavily on teamwork
Ability to thrive in a very dynamic environment, where plans can change quickly
Diploma in laboratory animal science equivalent to FELASA category AD




Minerva offers:

We believe in creating an agile working environment, so we have flexible working options including the option of working from home. We care about our employees’ well-being and offer health insurance and a quality conscious lunch scheme and monthly social activities.

We are an informal organization with a strong focus on open and honest communication. We value humour and a natural care for one another.




Application:

Please submit your application to us no later than September 15th 2025. The application must include a motivated cover letter and a CV addressing the listed qualifications. Applications will be evaluated continuously.




If you have questions regarding the position, please contact Philip G. J. Pedersen at php@minervaimaging.com (applications are not accepted via email).

Minerva Imaging is a scientifically driven and integrated CRO and CDMO specialized in targeted radionuclide therapies. We focus on the use of advanced animal models within oncology, cardiovascular diseases, and in vivo molecular imaging for translational research and drug development.




We engage with our sponsors to understand their scientific questions and discuss how our methods and capabilities can provide answers. Our facility located in Ølstykke, Denmark offers best–in–industry fully integrated radiopharmaceutical research, drug development, and manufacturing services.




As part of Minerva Imaging's recruitment policy we expect all candidates to provide their personal criminal record.




Minerva Imaging is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates of all backgrounds and experiences to apply.

Follow us on LinkedIn for the latest news updates or visit www.minervaimaging.com for more information.

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Grün, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

Title: AI Solutions & Automation Internship In Bali
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI Solutions & Automation Intern (Technical Business Development)

Location: Bali, Indonesia (Relocation Required)

Unpaid Internship

Start Date: ASAP

The Un-Job Opening Hook: Are you a technical visionary with a business mind, eager to bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI and real-world impact? This isn't just an internship; it's an invitation to engineer the future, integrating AI solutions and automation for a $90M USD portfolio of deep tech ventures. If you're ready to build, deploy, and transform industries from paradise, your journey starts here.

The Visionary "Why": At EX Venture, we are pioneers in human-AI collaboration, leveraging AI to bring companies to the next level. You will be at the forefront of this transformation, working directly with our portfolio companies to identify opportunities for AI integration, develop custom software, and implement automation solutions that drive efficiency and innovation. This is your chance to apply your technical skills to solve complex business problems with tangible, high-impact results, supported by a significant fund dedicated to innovation.

The "Contrarian Mind" Profile: You are a technically proficient individual with a strong understanding of AI/ML concepts and a keen interest in their business applications. You possess excellent problem-solving skills, a proactive approach to identifying opportunities, and the ability to communicate complex technical ideas to non-technical stakeholders. You are adaptable, eager to learn, and thrive in a fast-paced, project-driven environment. Experience with programming (Python preferred), data analysis, or AI/ML frameworks is highly valued.

The "Real-World Impact" Promise: Your technical expertise will directly accelerate the growth and efficiency of groundbreaking companies. You will be instrumental in:


AI Solution Design & Integration: Collaborating with business teams to identify pain points and design AI-powered solutions, then integrating them into existing workflows.
Custom Software Development: Developing bespoke AI software tools and scripts to automate processes and enhance operational capabilities.
Automation Implementation: Implementing automation strategies across various business functions to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Technical Consulting: Providing technical insights and support to clients and internal teams on AI capabilities and best practices.
Project Support: Assisting in the technical aspects of project management, ensuring the successful deployment and adoption of AI solutions.


The "Paradise & Purpose" Lifestyle: Imagine your morning commute being a walk to the beach, your lunch break a paddle session, and your evenings filled with inspiring conversations under the Balinese stars. Our campus in Bali offers a unique blend of professional intensity and unparalleled personal well-being. You'll relocate to and live

within a vibrant international community, accelerating your growth through cultural immersion. Integrate work and life to fuel creativity and peak performance.

The "Meritocratic Ascent" Pathway: Your technical ingenuity and problem-solving capabilities will define your trajectory. Exceptional performance in this role can lead to accelerated growth, specialized technical leadership positions, and potential full-time roles within our portfolio companies, all while living and working in an environment that fosters peak performance.

The "AI-First Immersion": You will be at the forefront of AI innovation, not just learning about it, but actively building and deploying AI solutions for real-world problems. Our curriculum is rebuilt weekly with the newest AI agents, ensuring you are always working with cutting-edge tools and methodologies.

Call to Action: If you're ready to engineer the future with AI, embrace a global adventure, and build an extraordinary career from paradise, apply now. This is your moment to join the revolution. We are specifically looking for talent ready to make the move and thrive in our unique ecosystem. Your journey starts here.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
🌟 Why You’ll Love This

AI is rapidly evolving and changing how we build, work, and think. So far we’ve been trailing behind a bit, but we are ready to catch up and figure out how best to utilize AI.

We are looking for an enthusiastic and skilled engineer to play a pivotal role in integrating artificial intelligence into both our daily work and our core product. This is an exciting opportunity to work across various departments, and help drive our AI initiatives forward.




🛠 What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be our internal AI champion — researching, prototyping, and guiding us as we explore new ways to use modern AI tools.

 Here’s what your days might include:

Spotting AI opportunities in both our products and day-to-day workflows.
Building prototypes using tools like Claude, loveable, etc.
Automating repetitive tasks to improve efficiency and make work more enjoyable .
Testing new AI tools, exploring their limits, and recommending what to adopt.
Collaborating with teams such as product, engineering, and others to understand pain points and help find solutions (maybe using AI?).
Running small experiments, creating demos, and showcasing AI's potential to inspire others.




🙋 Who You Are

You are someone who loves to build things and have experience with modern AI tools. No-code, low-code, dev-focused assistance, all of it is relevant for us.

You are great at running with an idea and turning it into a prototype. Helping others see the value of AI assistance is your jam, and communicating complex information in a simple manner is something you excel at. Working with different departments and teams is a possibility to learn more and have a broader impact. 

Extra points if you:




Have experience working with C#.
Have previously worked in a SaaS company.
Know TypeScript /* or JS in general */
Have worked with product or design teams.




🧑‍🤝‍🧑 Who We Are

At iPaper, we help retailers create better online shopping experiences. For years, we’ve been the go-to platform for turning static PDFs into interactive, shoppable catalogues. Now, with Horizon, we’re taking it further, transforming product feeds into scrollable, mobile-friendly catalogues designed for today’s digital-first shoppers.

We’re a company of 40 people across many nationalities, based in Aarhus. We’re friendly, down-to-earth, and a little nerdy (in the best way). We genuinely enjoy spending time together - whether it’s solving tricky bugs, celebrating a launch, or sharing cake in the kitchen.

Our office is built for both focus and fun - think foosball table, PlayStation, VR gear, rooftop terrace, spontaneous grill sessions, and plenty of other social events small and large 🔥

We’ve been around since 2006, so we’re stable and profitable, but we’ve kept part of that startup energy — agile, curious, and full of heart. You’ll be part of a company that cares deeply about the work and the people doing it.




🎁 What You’ll Get




Hybrid work setup (we love the office but flexibility is key).
Flexible hours and work-life-balance.
Time and budget for personal development.
High-spec gear and modern tools.
A fun, inclusive, and nerd-friendly team .
The opportunity to help shape how we work with AI from the ground up.

Want more details? Check out our public employee handbook: https://handbook.ipaper.io




✉️ How to Apply

 We’ve kept it simple. No resume. No cover letter.

 Just share your name, LinkedIn, and answer a few quick questions.




We’d love to hear from you.

 // The iPaper Team

Title: IT Platform Engineer for MLOps (Machine Learning) Area
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for hosting Python statistical and machine learning models, primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop these models on behalf of various enterprise domains within the bank. We manage AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud), which works alongside CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) to execute machine learning models for scoring payment transactions for fraud, including e-banking domestic/international and District International models deployed in CMDEP. Additionally, we are tasked with transforming the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.

As a MLOps IT Platform Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a “2 in a box” model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:


Implement automated pipelines for model training, validation and inference
Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and deployment
Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models


About you:


Minimum of 2 years of practical experience in MLOps platform to build model development deployment, execution and maintenance of ML pipelines
Hands-on experience in – Databricks asset bundles, Databricks MLFlow, Databricks MLOps stack customization, GitHub Actions for Databricks model deployments, Data bricks Unity Catalog
Experience in Python, Pyspark
Experience in Github tools Terraform and container orchestration, YAML
Understanding of Leveraging docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models
Problem-solving and debugging skills
Upper-Intermediate English skills


“We believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.”

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk , and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.


Show more
HTML:
Job Description

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for hosting Python statistical and machine learning models, primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop these models on behalf of various enterprise domains within the bank. We manage AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud), which works alongside CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) to execute machine learning models for scoring payment transactions for fraud, including e-banking domestic/international and District International models deployed in CMDEP. Additionally, we are tasked with transforming the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.

As a MLOps IT Platform Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a “2 in a box” model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:

  • Implement automated pipelines for model training, validation and inference
  • Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
  • Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and deployment
  • Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
  • Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models

About you:

  • Minimum of 2 years of practical experience in MLOps platform to build model development deployment, execution and maintenance of ML pipelines
  • Hands-on experience in – Databricks asset bundles, Databricks MLFlow, Databricks MLOps stack customization, GitHub Actions for Databricks model deployments, Data bricks Unity Catalog
  • Experience in Python, Pyspark
  • Experience in Github tools Terraform and container orchestration, YAML
  • Understanding of Leveraging docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models
  • Problem-solving and debugging skills
  • Upper-Intermediate English skills

“We believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.”

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:

  • Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
  • Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
  • Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
  • Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
  • Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.

See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk , and I will answer your questions!

#DK

A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: AI Solutions Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go we aim to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. 40% of all the food produced in the world is wasted, with a big impact on the planet: 10% of greenhouse gas emissions worldwide come from food loss and waste.

Too Good To Go operates the world’s largest B2C marketplace for surplus food. Through our app we connect businesses that have unsold, surplus food with consumers who can buy and enjoy it at a reduced price. We are a mission-driven certified B Corp.

We’re growing fast: Our community of over 124 million registered users across 19 countries has already saved more than 473+ million meals from going to waste - together avoiding more than 1.278.000 tonnes of CO2e from entering the atmosphere.

In 2023, Apple recognised Too Good To Go as Winner at the annual App Store Awards, for our app’s exceptional user experience and profound impact on society.

We always look for talented people with diverse backgrounds to join our team. Right now, we’re recruiting our very first AI Solutions Developer!

Your mission

As our AI Solutions Developer you will design and implement artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions that automate and optimize our commercial business processes, with the aim of driving Sales efficiency. You will partner with stakeholders across commercial, product and engineering teams to identify opportunities for process optimization by leveraging AI, and lead the design, testing and scaling of solutions, while ensuring alignment with technical standards, security, and compliance requirements.

You will tackle specific business challenges in our sales operations on a project basis, and leverage your deep knowledge of AI tools in the market to develop MVP solutions, and embed these into the daily sales processes.

By combining your technical skills and commercial understanding, you will help our sales teams across 19 countries work more effectively, spend time on what matters, ultimately leading to more food saved. This role will be based in Copenhagen and reports to our Chief Commercial Officer.

Role Description


Opportunity Identification: You will be gathering context of existing sales processes to assess key opportunities for automation and AI/ML solutions in our operations, challenging current setups, and being a sparring partner to the rest of the Global Commercial teams and broader organization.
Solution Design & Architecture: You will lead the end-to-end selection and design of AI/ML systems for commercial teams, from requesting data pipelines, selecting the appropriate models to use, sourcing/developing tools and prompts, and deploying and monitoring solutions.
Change Management: Your job is to drive change in the organization, and you will be working with other teams in the Global Commercial function to introduce new AI tools and improve ways of working in our operations for lasting impact.
Stakeholder Collaboration: The work is cross-functional by nature, and you will be engaging with colleagues across the company to map workflows and identify automation opportunities. You will be responsible for translating business needs into powerful technical solutions.
Platform & Tooling Selection: As an internal AI expert, you will be recommending which AI platforms and tools we should leverage in our commercial teams. You will oversee procurement and integration of third-party AI services in the Sales community, in close collaboration with our Tech and Legal teams.
Security & Compliance: You will be expected to comply with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR) and organizational security policies.
Community & Knowledge Sharing. As a domain expert, you will form a community with other data scientists, ML engineers, and developers in the company on AI practices, and be an ambassador of the AI journey across all teams.


Requirements


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
Solid experience with business process automation platforms and iPaaS solutions.
Strong understanding of APIs and webhook integrations.
Experience with JSON, data mapping, and transformation.
Proficiency in workflow logic, conditional operations, and error handling.
Experience designing and implementing automated workflow solutions using modern workflow automation platforms (such as Make.com, N8N, Zapier, or similar tools)
Strong AI prompting skills, experience leveraging APIs to connect data sources, and building MVP solutions.
Experience with project and change management, preferably from introduction of new tech solutions.
Good understanding of sales processes, preferably in a B2B environment.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a global social impact company and certified B Corporation, where you can see real and tangible impact in your role.
Work alongside an international community of users, partners and 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries on the same important sustainability mission.
Personal and professional development in a fast-paced scale-up environment.
An inclusive company culture where you can bring your authentic self to work.
A strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate success and socialise with colleagues that care.


Benefits


Work Flexibly
Enjoy hybrid working from our great offices, at home or abroad.
Extra parental leave and days off beyond local legislation and the option to take an extra week of unpaid leave
Health insurance and pension plans (subject to country of employment).
Additional days off for significant life events
Celebrate and Socialise
Regular social events like summer and winter parties.
Coffee, snacks and fully-equipped kitchens.
Get to know our community with a monthly free Surprise Bag.
Paid volunteer time through our Shareback volunteering programme
Women in the Workplace, P.R.I.D.E., People of Colour and Functionally Diverse Employee Resource Groups

How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

  • An inclusive company culture where you can bring your authentic self to work.
  • A strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate success and socialise with colleagues that care.

Benefits

  • Work Flexibly
    • Enjoy hybrid working from our great offices, at home or abroad.

Title: AI Engineer in leading SaaS Scale Up!
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Help us reinvent product lifecycle management, with AI | Copenhagen




We’re going AI-first, and we need someone who’s already built real things with AI agents and AI tooling. If you’ve used GPT, LangChain, Claude, or similar to automate processes, integrate APIs, or create production-grade AI flows, this is your stage.




Our mission: build the most advanced, intelligent product lifecycle management (PLM) platform for the fashion and lifestyle industry. Our customers are global brands and suppliers who use our platform to collaborate, manage collections, and streamline every stage from idea to finished product. We help them digitize workflows, optimize resources, and make better decisions, faster.




This isn’t a research role. This is about building AI-driven tools that work, ship fast, and deliver impact.




What You’ll Do

Build internal AI agents that automate everything from product data enrichment to supplier communication flows.
Use OpenAI (GPT-4o), LangChain, n8n, and custom .NET/React/Azure-based services to develop real, end-to-end solutions.
Translate domain knowledge (from product, customer success, and support teams) into prompt-based tools, scripts, and interfaces.
Develop backend logic in .NET and connect with our main platform via REST APIs, webhooks, and Azure services.
Collaborate directly with the founder, product team, and engineers to prioritize high-impact use cases.
Document and test your agents so they can scale across customers, countries, and product lines.
Optionally: build or connect frontend UIs in React or with low/no-code tools like Retool.




Who You Are

You have a Master’s degree or 3–5 years of relevant experience building software with AI agents or AI tooling, in production or through substantial real-world projects.
You’ve already built real things with AI – whether that’s agents, automations, prompt-driven workflows, or integrations between AI tools and APIs.
You’re comfortable with .NET/C#, React, REST APIs, and Azure-based databases/storage.
You’ve used tools like LangChain, GPT, Claude, Supabase, or n8n, and ideally connected them together into working systems.
You love shipping fast, learning fast, and solving real customer problems.
You think in systems. You see the flow between tools, prompts, users, and data.
Bonus: experience with product lifecycle management, supply chain, or fashion industry workflows.




Why Join Us

Work on real-world AI problems, not gimmicks.
Be part of a small, ambitious, and product-driven team with deep market traction.
Ship and own projects that get used by brands and suppliers worldwide.
Help define how AI is applied in one of the most operationally complex and underserved domains: product development and collaboration.
Enjoy full autonomy, fast feedback loops, and the ability to shape the product and stack.
Based in Copenhagen? Great. Prefer hybrid or remote (within CET ±2)? Also great.




Tech Stack You’ll Touch

GPT-4o / OpenAI Functions / Claude
LangChain / n8n
.NET / C# / React
Azure Functions, Azure Storage, Azure SQL
REST APIs (internal and customer)
Retool (optional)
Other tech stacks that can improve efficiency




Compensation

Competitive salary based on experience
Equity/warrants
Office in central Copenhagen with hybrid flexibility
Real ownership. No bureaucracy.




**OPEN TO EU RELOCATORS!**




Contact hiring manager, Luqman Mohammed-Brown at L.Mohammed-Brown@tenthrevolution.com if you have any questions.
