Title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
Job Description

The Agentic Tribe is revolutionizing the chatbot and voice assistance landscape with Gen3, a cutting-edge AI Agent system that's pushing the boundaries of conversational AI. Gen3 is not your typical chatbot; it's a goal-oriented, dynamic, and truly conversational system capable of reasoning, planning, and adapting to user needs in real-time. By leveraging a multi-agent architecture and advanced language models, Gen3 delivers personalized and engaging user experiences, moving beyond scripted interactions to handle complex tasks and "off-script" inquiries with ease.

We are delighted to be hiring a Senior Machine Learning Scientist for the AI Agent product at Zendesk. You will own a designated product area and revolutionize how our customers experience our products. This is an exciting opportunity to bridge the gap between cutting-edge ML research and real-world impact. You'll have the freedom to shape the product roadmap, discover innovative ML applications, and collaborate with a talented cross-functional team.

Key Responsibilities


You'll be part of a team responsible for designing and testing novel AI solutions for real business problems
You'll own the full research projects end-to-end from understanding business requirements to design, implementation, experimentation and reporting
You'll discuss your and others ideas in the research team regularly and provide peer review for your colleagues work
You'll keep up with the NLP and ML fields and literature and introduce new concepts discovered as potential solutions to our business problems
You'll work closely with AIengineers helping them implement your designs into our production system
You'll use suitable tools and technologies for rapid implementation and quickly testing your hypotheses while keeping in mind the requirements of future production implementation
You’ll collaborate with Product managers and other non technical stakeholders to discover product roadmap.


Who You Are


Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.
Proven record of Machine Learning or NLP research, ideally in industry.
Knowledge of building deep learning neural network architectures, ideally with focus on NLP.
Ability to implement ideas from research literature into proof-of-concept models.
Practical approach for researching machine learning solutions to business problems.
Huge bonus if you have experience with LLMs, Prompt Engineering and AI Agent Context Management.
Ideally have experience with conversational AI and voice technologies, including text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-speech (STS).
A positive, pro-active team player who is passionate about their craft, is keen to take part in product discussions and cares about helping the team deliver.
Great communication skill and fluency in English.


How do we measure success in this role?


How well your work aligns with the overall product roadmap and strategic goals.
Effectiveness in collaborating with product managers, engineers, designers, and other stakeholders
Discovery and Ideation - ability to identify new opportunities within the product area, as well as their ability to prioritize and champion these ideas.


The Interview Process

We are excited to learn more about you, so we want to be transparent about what you can expect from our interview process:


Initial Call with Talent Team - 15 mins
Interview with one member of the Hiring Team - 45 minutes
Take-home technical/research challenge
A technical interview with two of our scientists to talk more in-depth about your technical experience and answer any questions you might have - 1 hour
Final interview with 2 of the following: CTO or Engineering Manager/Director - 45 minutes


About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

  • Ability to implement ideas from research literature into proof-of-concept models.
  • Practical approach for researching machine learning solutions to business problems.
  • Huge bonus if you have experience with LLMs, Prompt Engineering and AI Agent Context Management.
  • Ideally have experience with conversational AI and voice technologies, including text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-speech (STS).
  • A positive, pro-active team player who is passionate about their craft, is keen to take part in product discussions and cares about helping the team deliver.
  • Great communication skill and fluency in English.

How do we measure success in this role?

  • How well your work aligns with the overall product roadmap and strategic goals.
  • Effectiveness in collaborating with product managers, engineers, designers, and other stakeholders
  • Discovery and Ideation - ability to identify new opportunities within the product area, as well as their ability to prioritize and champion these ideas.

The Interview Process

We are excited to learn more about you, so we want to be transparent about what you can expect from our interview process:

  • Initial Call with Talent Team - 15 mins
  • Interview with one member of the Hiring Team - 45 minutes
  • Take-home technical/research challenge
  • A technical interview with two of our scientists to talk more in-depth about your technical experience and answer any questions you might have - 1 hour
  • Final interview with 2 of the following: CTO or Engineering Manager/Director - 45 minutes

About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: Cloud & AI Solution Engineer – AI Applications
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you insatiably curious, deeply passionate about the realm of AI & applications, and ready to tackle complex challenges in a dynamic environment? If so, we invite you to join our team as a Cloud & AI Solution Engineer in AI Applications for commercial customers at Microsoft. Here, you'll be at the forefront of cutting-edge projects that leverage the latest technologies to drive meaningful impact. Join us and be part of a team that thrives on collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning.

Microsoft is transforming the developer experience for AI applications across the development lifecycle. With AI Foundry and seamless integration with Azure AI, we’re leading the way in Agentic AI development where AI agents streamline development and operations. As an AI Apps Solution Engineer, you’ll help customers boost productivity and become AI-native.

As an AI Applications Solution Engineer (SE), you will play a pivotal role in helping enterprise AI developers unlock the full potential of Microsoft’s AI-powered stack across every stage of the development lifecycle. You’ll collaborate closely with engineering leaders and platform teams to accelerate AI Foundry, Azure AI, and Responsible AI, through hands-on engagements like Proof of Concepts, hackathons, and architecture workshops. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth, develop deep business acumen, hone your technical skills, and become adept at solution design and deployment. You’ll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate AI applications development into their deployment workflows. In summary, you’ll help customers modernize their applications and realize the full value of Microsoft’s AI platform, all while enjoying flexible work opportunities.

As a trusted technical advisor, you’ll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate AI applications and agents into their development workflows. In summary, you’ll help customers modernize their applications leveraging AI and realize the full value of Microsoft’s platform.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities


Drive technical sales with decision makers using demos and PoCs to influence solution design and enable production deployments.
Lead hands-on engagements—hackathons, code-with sessions, and architecture workshops—to accelerate adoption of Microsoft’s developer tools and cloud platforms.
Build trusted relationships with developers and platform leads, co-designing secure, scalable architectures and solutions
Resolve technical blockers and objections, collaborating with engineering to share insights and improve products.
Maintain deep expertise in AI Foundry & App architecture (Agentic AI framework, Semantic Kernel, Foundry SDK, Responsible AI) and App architecture/cloud native dev (APIs, containerization, microservices, event-driven, Python, Java or .NET).
Maintain and grow expertise in AI Management & Security (Gen AI Ops, Sentinel, orchestrator, monitoring).
Represent Microsoft through thought leadership in developer communities and customer forums


Qualifications

Required Qualifications (RQs)


Proven years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A few years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience  OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A couple year(s) technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience  OR equivalent experience
Expert on full stack App architecture design / modernization and cloud native dev (e.g., APIs, containerization, microservices, event-driven, Python, Java, .NET)
Expert for AI & ML models (e.g., Agentic AI framework, AI Foundry, Semantic Kernel, Foundry SDK, Responsible AI, fine-tuning/inferencing, etc.)
Proven ability to lead technical engagements (e.g., hackathons, PoCs, MVPs) that drive production-scale outcomes.


Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Several years technical pre-sales, technical consulting, or technology delivery, or related experience OR equivalent experience
Proven years experience with cloud and hybrid, or on premises infrastructure, architecture designs, migrations, industry standards, and/or technology management
Proficient on Agentic framework, AI Management & Security (e.g., Gen AI Ops, Sentinel, Responsible AI, orchestrator, monitoring)
Skilled with 1 or more frameworks, tools, languages (e.g., GitHub, Copilot Studio, VS Code, Jupyter, PyCharm, Node.js, Python, Java, C#, C++, AI Assisted Dev Tools)
Proficiency in Danish is preferred.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Erfaren Data Scientist med Interesse i teknikken
Place: Brøndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Fra Python til produkt – du har styr på hele kæden.

Du er landet det rigtige sted, hvis du elsker at dykke dybt i data, bygge modeller med substans og sikre, at de faktisk gør en forskel. Hos Danske Spil leder vi efter en teknisk stærk og erfaren Data Scientist, der trives i hele modellens livscyklus – fra dataudforskning til performance i produktion.

“Vi tror på ansvarlig anvendelse af data og udvikler løsninger, der gør en reel forskel – for både forretningen og samfundet. Vi arbejder tæt sammen, er stolte af vores faglighed og har det sjovt imens.” – Trine Brandt, Leder af Data Science




Velkommen til Data Science i Danske Spil

Vi er et team af specialister med skarpe hjerner og varme hjerter. Vores løsninger hjælper med at identificere problematisk spilleadfærd, bekæmpe hvidvask og skabe personaliserede kundeoplevelser. Vi arbejder med nogle af Danmarks mest spændende datasæt og har fokus på at skabe ansvarlig innovation. Teamet består af seks Data Scientists (inkl. dig) og en Product Owner og er en del af BI & Data Science-afdelingen, som også rummer Data Engineers og BI Business Partnere. Vi er organiseret i agile teams med korte feedback loops og kontinuerlig læring i centrum.




Lidt om dig, dit ansvar og dine opgaver.

Som erfaren Data Scientist hos os bliver du en teknisk nøglespiller i design, udvikling og drift af modeller, der faktisk bliver brugt – og gør en forskel. Du arbejder tæt sammen med både forretningen og vores Data Engineers, og tager ansvar for, at dine modeller er veldokumenterede, robuste og produktionsparate.

Du har erfaring med at operationalisere modeller og tænker hele livscyklussen ind: fra feature engineering og modeltræning til monitorering og gentræning. Du holder øje med performance, griber ind, når noget ændrer sig – og er ikke bange for at remodellere, når det giver bedst mening.

Dine opgaver:

Udvikling af machine learning-modeller til fx adfærdsanalyse, churn prediction og risikovurdering
Udvikling af generative AI-løsninger, hvor det giver værdi
Feature engineering og dataforberedelse i Spark/Databricks
Opsætning af eksperimentdesign og effektmåling
Monitorering, gentræning og løbende forbedring af modeller i drift
Tæt samarbejde med forretningen om krav, data og brug af modeller
Dokumentation og review af modeller sammen med teamet

Din tekniske værktøjskasse:

Vi forestiller os, at du har mindst 3-5 års erfaring som Data Scientist og kan sætte kryds ved flere af disse:

Stærk i Python og biblioteker som scikit-learn, hyperopt og PySpark
Vant til at arbejde i MLFlow og Databricks (eller tilsvarende cloud-baserede platforme)
Kendskab til både supervised/unsupervised læring og GenAI
Dygtig til performance-måling og forståelse af fx bias/variance trade-offs
Erfaring med at formidle komplekse modeller og resultater til ikke-tekniske stakeholders

Din profil:

Arbejder struktureret og selvstændigt – men trives i et samarbejdsorienteret miljø
Elsker at nørde og lære nyt – og gerne deler din viden
Har lyst til at tage ansvar og være med til at sætte retning
Du har indsigt eller interesse i sportsspil, casino, skrabespil, poker og/eller lotterier.




Vil du være med til at underholde danskerne?

Vi læser ansøgninger igennem løbende, men deadline for at søge er den 15. august. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Data Science Trine Brandt på tbra@danskespil.dk. Hvis du har spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Mette Overgaard Holm på meho@danskespil.dk.




Stillingen er placeret i en afdeling, hvor fremvisning af straffeattest er påkrævet for at overholde reglerne om forebyggelse af hvidvask og terrorfinansiering. Når du indkaldes til samtale, skal straffeattesten derfor indhentes og uploades i rekrutteringssystemet inden 1. samtale.




Vi glæder os til at møde dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Pia, Philip, Tryggvi, Marie Louise, Johan og Trine

Show more

  • Du har indsigt eller interesse i sportsspil, casino, skrabespil, poker og/eller lotterier.

Vi læser ansøgninger igennem løbende, men deadline for at søge er den 15. august. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Data Science Trine Brandt på tbra@danskespil.dk. Hvis du har spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Mette Overgaard Holm på meho@danskespil.dk.


Stillingen er placeret i en afdeling, hvor fremvisning af straffeattest er påkrævet for at overholde reglerne om forebyggelse af hvidvask og terrorfinansiering. Når du indkaldes til samtale, skal straffeattesten derfor indhentes og uploades i rekrutteringssystemet inden 1. samtale.


Vi glæder os til at møde dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Pia, Philip, Tryggvi, Marie Louise, Johan og Trine

Title: Computer Vision Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern c omputer v ision techniques.

As a Computer Vision Developer you will develop new features to our existing products that help improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to our user’s problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid software engineering foundation from a bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering or IT. Master’s degree with specialization in computer vision, robotics, or machine learning is a plus.
Have hands-on experience with software development using C++ and Python. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement. Knowledge of C# is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Have machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our products .

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Talent Aquisition Specialist, Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Talent Aquisition Specialist, Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Freelance Chemistry Expert - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Chemistry, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI.
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers.
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's Degree or PhD in Chemistry and 3 years of professional experience.
You have a Bachelor's Degree in Chemistry and 6+ years of professional experience.
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above.
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: AI Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hvis du får helt kriller i fingrene af muligheden for at arbejde med AI - og er OpenAI (måske) so last year for dig 🥱

Så er du landet på den helt rette jobannonce 🙌




Vi søger en dygtig og engageret AI-udvikler, der brænder for at optimere processer gennem data, automatisering og avanceret teknologi. Hos os får du din egen stol og skrivebord på vores kontor i Carlsberg Byen. Du vil blive en del af et nyt AI team i Customer Success. Du kan naturligvis ikke gøre det hele alene, så du vil skulle arbejde tæt sammen med vores andre AI udviklere i vores Product Development afdeling 🙌




Dét kan jeg godt se mig selv blive en del af - men hvad skal jeg lave?

Du vil få en central rolle i at udvikle og implementere AI-løsninger, der effektiviserer vores interne forretningsgange – blandt andet inden for dataopsamling, voice-based assistenter og intelligent procesautomatisering. Det kunne være via OpenAI, men det kan også være, at du er større fan af en anden, lignende teknologi - og så ruller vi med den i stedet. Du er eksperten 🎈

Vi ser AI som et must i vores fremtidige løsninger. I det hele taget bliver din opgave at være med til at finde ud af, hvordan vi kan gøre brug af AI i vores virksomhed på bedst mulig vis. Det er ærligt ikke en særlig konkret jobbeskrivelse. Det ved vi, men det er et udtryk for, at du her får en ren tavle og AI-legeplads at arbejde med 🛝




Hvad er højest på vores ønskeliste?

🐈 ⬛ Du har leget eller arbejdet med AI-teknologier og ved, hvordan man får dem til at spinde

🐍 Du ved, at Python ikke kun er en slangeart. Om du kan tæmme slangearten, er ikke så vigtigt, men vi håber, at du kan tæmme den anden variant.

🌟 Du kan ikke lade være med konstant at følge med og udforske, hvordan AI kan gøre ting smartere




Hvis du også har erfaring på tastaturet med C# og Azure, kan vi ikke få armene ned af bare begejstring 🙌

Det er næppe verdens længste ønskeliste, men vi er trætte af det klassiske jobopslag, der næsten ikke er andet end krav til dig. Vi kunne aldrig drømme om at skrive, at vi forventer, at du har x-års erfaring. Det siger jo ingenting om dine kompetencer 🤷 ♀️




Vi vil ikke love dig guld og grønne skove, men:

Hos os er der plads til dig, som du er. Måske er du gladest i din Copenhell-hoodie eller i en hvid skjorte. Måske er du en ægte vin connaisseur 🍷, måske er du mest bare til pepsi eller cola🥤 (som vi iøvrigt har et helt køleskab af på kontoret).

Uanset hvad skal der være plads til dig som menneske og også til det, der giver dig energi uden for arbejdet. Derfor tilbyder vi alle vores medarbejdere op til 7 ugers betalt frihed om året(!) Derudover kan vi love dig en kollegial arbejdsplads med frokostordning, sundheds- og tandforsikring, god kaffe ☕️ og naturligvis muligheden for hjemmearbejde.




Interesseret?

Hvis du kan se dig selv i rollen, vil vi meget gerne høre fra dig. Vi ved godt, at AI stadig er et område i udvikling – og derfor lægger vi ikke vægt på diplomer eller mange års erfaring.

Vi er ikke ude efter en traditionel ansøgning og CV 📄

Vi har lavet fire spørgsmål, som du skal besvare, og hvis du har lyst vil vi gerne se eksempler på noget du allerede har lavet👌Det kan være små projekter, kodeeksempler, en video eller noget helt andet – vælg det format, der giver bedst mening for dig.

Du er også velkommen til at skrive et par ord om, hvorfor du er interesseret i stillingen – men det er helt op til dig ✌️

Vi vil gerne kunne sige velkommen til vores kommende kollega 1. november 2025, så smid din billet i puljen. The sooner the better 🥳 Vi lover, at vi ikke lader dig hænge for længe i uvished!

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Customer Success Manager Lene Bech på lene.bech@visma.com.

For spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen kan du kontakte Inja Nielsen på inja.nielsen@visma.com.




Hvem er Visma DataLøn og ProLøn?

Visma DataLøn og ProLøn er eksperter i løn og HR. Sammen skaber vi en enklere hverdag for vores 65.000 kunder, som vi bl.a. producerer over 500.000 lønsedler for om måneden. Vi er en del af Visma-koncernen, som er Skandinaviens førende leverandør af løn- og HR-systemer... og sponsor af verdens bedste cykelhold🚴

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Randers SV, DK, 8940)
Description:
14/08/2025

Group CFO

DNK-Randers, Danish Crown Vej

Data Scientist

Do you believe there’s a connection between bacon and data? Do you want to be part of a team whose mission is to turn data into delicious insights?

At Danish Crown, we believe that just as bacon is a key product in our portfolio, data is the essential ingredient that drives our innovation and success, helping us to optimize processes, predict trends, and maintain our leadership in the industry – and we’re now looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team and help us in this journey ahead of us.

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at Danish Crown, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets to uncover valuable insights, developing predictive models, and working closely with cross-functional teams to drive data-informed decision-making. You will be involved in various projects, such as:


Commodity, livestock, and product forecasting.
Object detection and tracking in real-time video feeds from production sites.


Success starts with a team

You will become part of the Data Science team within the Data, Analytics & AI space in the Global IT department. We work on multiple initiatives for various business units, with tasks around delivering data analysis and insights, modelling of complex data sources, and research and implementation of machine learning and deep learning models for tasks such as time-series forecasting, image recognition, or natural language processing, amongst others.

We are curious about the latest developments in our space, and therefore actively encourage everyone to have an innovative mindset and propose their ideas for further incubation.

Key Responsibilities

You’ll be part of helping Danish Crown become a data-first organization. Your main tasks will include:


Providing actionable insights, identify trends and measure performance by conducting advanced statistical and other analyses.
Developing analytical solutions by creating, testing and implementing complex models and algorithms.
Implementing scalable, sustainable solutions addressing business needs in collaboration with AI/ML and Data Engineers.
Explaining the design, functioning and output of analytical models/solutions to consumers.
Staying up to date with the latest trends and advancements in data science and machine learning.


Who are we looking for?

A passionate and detail-oriented colleague with a knack for uncovering insights from data, thriving in a collaborative environment and always eager to learn and apply new technologies.

With a strong analytical mindset, you enjoy solving complex problems and your excellent communication skills allow you to effectively convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role.
Strong programming skills in Python. SQL is a plus.
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.
Fluent in English. Understanding of Danish can be a plus.
Familiar with cloud platforms and version control.


Appetite For More?

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Manager, Data Science Global IT, Francesc Joan Riera at (+45) 60 90 67 72.

We review candidates continuously, so let us know why you are the right candidate for the job and send it together with your CV. We aim for a start, as soon as possible – will wait for the right person.

We are a food company owned by Danish farmers supplying high-quality food to customers and consumers worldwide. From butchers to business developers, we're more than 24,000 colleagues, all committed to lowering our carbon footprint and becoming climate-neutral by 2050 for better food and a brighter future.
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models to meet project-specific guidelines.
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
Ensuring clarity, consistency, and factual accuracy.

You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
Experience with Cloud sourcing platform is a plus
Code review experience is a must

Title: Founder’s Assistant at fast-growing AI startup
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Copli

Copli is a fast-growing GenAI software company transforming content creation workflows for the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies. Over the past 12 months, we’ve established ourselves as a trusted partner, collaborating with many of the top pharma companies globally - and we are growing at a rapid pace.

We are building an innovative, agentic system that pushes the boundaries of what GenAI can do - redefining the “Medical, Legal, and Regulatory” (MLR) review process for promotional materials. This process is currently conducted 100% manually and requires specialized expertise. At Copli, we’re automating it, saving days of manual work for our users.

Our founders are ex-BCG, ex-Accura, and top AI engineers. We operate with the same analytical rigor and strategic thinking you’d find in top-tier consulting firms. If your goal is to work at a MBB (McKinsey, BCG, Bain) or in a top-tier strategy role, this is the perfect training ground.

About The Role

We are looking for a CEO/Founder’s Assistant to work directly with the CEO and COO across a wide range of strategic and operational activities. This is a unique opportunity to work side-by-side with the leadership team, gaining insight into how enterprise sales, large-scale customer projects, and financial strategy come together in a high-growth startup.

You will be exposed to diverse areas of the business, from sales and customer engagement to financial modelling and operational execution.

What You Will Work On


Sales-related tasks: Outreach to prospects, joining sales calls, preparing proposals, and managing follow-up actions.
Enterprise project management: Coordinating ongoing projects with large corporate customers.
Financial modelling: Supporting cash-flow and scenario planning for the business.
Ad hoc strategic and operational tasks: From research and analysis to preparing presentations and helping drive new initiatives forward.


You Are a Great Fit If You


Have strong analytical skills
Are proactive, organized, and comfortable managing multiple priorities.
Believe that LLMs can improve every task, or have experience/strong interest in GenAI.
Are curious about business strategy, sales, and technology, and eager to learn quickly.
Want to experience firsthand how to build and scale a tech company


What We Offer


Direct exposure to the decision-making of a scaling tech startup.
Mentorship from founders with backgrounds in top-tier management consulting, law, and AI innovation.
A role where your work will have tangible, immediate impact.
Flexible working hours (approx. 20 hours/week) to fit around your studies.
Excellent breakfast, chef-prepared lunch, and great coffee at our Copenhagen office.


How To Apply

Email Jacob (CEO, co-founder) at hello@copli.io with your CV and a note about your motivation.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

  • Mentorship from founders with backgrounds in top-tier management consulting, law, and AI innovation.
  • A role where your work will have tangible, immediate impact.
  • Flexible working hours (approx. 20 hours/week) to fit around your studies.
  • Excellent breakfast, chef-prepared lunch, and great coffee at our Copenhagen office.

How To Apply

Email Jacob (CEO, co-founder) at hello@copli.io with your CV and a note about your motivation.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Predictive AI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 30617

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to explore and develop machine learning models in financial crime prevention. The role is permanent and can be based in Denmark, Finland and Sweden.

About Our Team

Meet the AI & Machine Learning team. Our role is to improve how we detect and investigate financial crime with the help of AI and machine learning, to keep our customers, Nordea and society safe.

Our team is about 25 people working out of Stockholm, Helsinki and Copenhagen as a part of the group financial crime prevention (GFCP) unit that provides financial crime prevention services to all of the bank.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us. 

Main responsibilities in this role:


Prototype and explore the feasibility of new AI use cases in collaboration with business stakeholders
Implement, deploy, and monitor our AI applications
Rigorously evaluate and improve the quality of our AI applications


Who You Are

We believe that you're an energetic individual who enjoys bringing ideas, exploring their potential, and presenting the results. You're passionate about building machine learning models that can identify complex financial crimes, ensuring both the bank’s and society's safety. No need for any prior experience in banking or finance.

Your background and skills include:


MSc or PhD in a filed related to predictive or statistical modelling
At least four years work experience fully dedicated to predictive machine learning model development
A knack for tackling complex problems and creating understandable and robust solutions
Strong communication and presentation skills, explaining complex ideas to different stakeholders


What We Offer

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 08/09/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Peter Nödtveidt, Head of Predictive AI in FCIIA, at peter.nodtveidt@nordea.com.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Only for candidates in Finland: A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Want to join us as we take AI to the next level? Then you might be our AI Engineer.

We are a market leader in the utilization of AI, including LLMs, and have even greater visions. In the Digital Incubation and AI team, we work both as an internal AI consultant and development team, and as a strategic team, shaping our approach and architecture around generative AI. And this is where you come in.

As our AI Engineer, you will collaborate with both your colleagues on the team, and stakeholders across the company to scope, develop, and deploy leading AI solutions, as well as help design and build the underlying AI infrastructure, including working directly with AI models.

The team you will be part of - Digital Incubation and AI

As part of our Digital, Data and IT (DDI) function of +200 employees, we support the GN Group across the world, delivering business critical applications and infrastructure.

As part of our inclusive and engaging team of AI developers, digital product designers, adoption specialists, and others, you will receive a warm welcome from all members.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:

Your role will involve guiding the evolution of AI technologies through the selection, tweaking, and deployment of models, as well as crafting the core architecture and platforms, and developing solutions for end users.

Specifically, your work will include, but is not limited to, the following assignments


Scoping, planning, and development of AI solutions on various platforms.
Documenting existing processes as well as the developed solutions.
AI model development, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training and evaluation.
Participating and leading projects to scope, develop, and deploy value-driving solutions.
Further iterating solutions once they reach production in a DevOps setup.


You will be challenged with the complexity of a truly global organization and in this context, you will need to navigate across cultures, functions, and organizational levels.

To thrive in the role, we imagine that you:

We imagine that you are team-oriented and can manage your own tasks when necessary. You are result-oriented with an open mind-set for collaborating. You demonstrate accountability and are prepared to operate within a fluid work environment, having experience with Agile practices or being open to acquiring that knowledge.

Moreover, we imagine that you have:


A higher educational background within Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science or a related field of study.
Proficiency in relevant programming languages, such as Python (prioritized), Java, or C++.
Experience working with data and data libraries, such as NumPy and pandas.
Experience in designing and experimenting with algorithms and models for various use cases.
Familiarity with Azure app Service - and applicants with familiarity with Azure DevOps and experience with both open-source models and frameworks are encouraged to apply.
Fluency in written and spoken English, since it is essential you can communicate effortlessly with your colleagues, no matter where in the World they are. If you are fluent in one of the Scandinavian languages it is a benefit, but this not a perquisite for the position.


Your new position will benefit from your openness to learning and your inquisitive nature.

We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy, that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure success for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 7th of September 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying – quick and easy.

If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Thomas Grønfeldt Senger, head of Digital Incubation and AI, on LinkedIn or on +45 27799947.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiast.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.

Title: AI Solutions & Automation Internship In Bali
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI Solutions & Automation Intern (Technical Business Development)

Location: Bali, Indonesia (Relocation Required)

Unpaid Internship

Start Date: ASAP

The Un-Job Opening Hook: Are you a technical visionary with a business mind, eager to bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI and real-world impact? This isn't just an internship; it's an invitation to engineer the future, integrating AI solutions and automation for a $90M USD portfolio of deep tech ventures. If you're ready to build, deploy, and transform industries from paradise, your journey starts here.

The Visionary "Why": At EX Venture, we are pioneers in human-AI collaboration, leveraging AI to bring companies to the next level. You will be at the forefront of this transformation, working directly with our portfolio companies to identify opportunities for AI integration, develop custom software, and implement automation solutions that drive efficiency and innovation. This is your chance to apply your technical skills to solve complex business problems with tangible, high-impact results, supported by a significant fund dedicated to innovation.

The "Contrarian Mind" Profile: You are a technically proficient individual with a strong understanding of AI/ML concepts and a keen interest in their business applications. You possess excellent problem-solving skills, a proactive approach to identifying opportunities, and the ability to communicate complex technical ideas to non-technical stakeholders. You are adaptable, eager to learn, and thrive in a fast-paced, project-driven environment. Experience with programming (Python preferred), data analysis, or AI/ML frameworks is highly valued.

The "Real-World Impact" Promise: Your technical expertise will directly accelerate the growth and efficiency of groundbreaking companies. You will be instrumental in:


AI Solution Design & Integration: Collaborating with business teams to identify pain points and design AI-powered solutions, then integrating them into existing workflows.
Custom Software Development: Developing bespoke AI software tools and scripts to automate processes and enhance operational capabilities.
Automation Implementation: Implementing automation strategies across various business functions to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Technical Consulting: Providing technical insights and support to clients and internal teams on AI capabilities and best practices.
Project Support: Assisting in the technical aspects of project management, ensuring the successful deployment and adoption of AI solutions.


The "Paradise & Purpose" Lifestyle: Imagine your morning commute being a walk to the beach, your lunch break a paddle session, and your evenings filled with inspiring conversations under the Balinese stars. Our campus in Bali offers a unique blend of professional intensity and unparalleled personal well-being. You'll relocate to and live

within a vibrant international community, accelerating your growth through cultural immersion. Integrate work and life to fuel creativity and peak performance.

The "Meritocratic Ascent" Pathway: Your technical ingenuity and problem-solving capabilities will define your trajectory. Exceptional performance in this role can lead to accelerated growth, specialized technical leadership positions, and potential full-time roles within our portfolio companies, all while living and working in an environment that fosters peak performance.

The "AI-First Immersion": You will be at the forefront of AI innovation, not just learning about it, but actively building and deploying AI solutions for real-world problems. Our curriculum is rebuilt weekly with the newest AI agents, ensuring you are always working with cutting-edge tools and methodologies.

Call to Action: If you're ready to engineer the future with AI, embrace a global adventure, and build an extraordinary career from paradise, apply now. This is your moment to join the revolution. We are specifically looking for talent ready to make the move and thrive in our unique ecosystem. Your journey starts here.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
Show more

Title: Head of Product & AI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Simply.TV

Simply.TV is a high-growth, PE-backed metadata and content discovery platform serving broadcasters, telcos, and streaming platforms globally. Backed by Summit Partners, we recently expanded into the U.S. with the acquisition of FYI (formerly Red Bee Media's metadata division) — marking the first step in our ambitious M&A and global growth strategy.

We operate at the intersection of metadata and content intelligence, powering modern entertainment discovery experiences. We are now building the next generation of data-driven products: blending editorial-grade quality with AI-powered automation, analytics, and personalized discovery.

The role

We're seeking a Head of Product & AI to lead our full product organization and AI product strategy. This is a highly strategic role responsible for setting and executing the company-wide product roadmap — with direct accountability for both customer-facing product innovation and AI-driven internal tooling.

As Simply.TV transitions from a pure metadata provider to a broader data and analytics platform, this leader will be pivotal in scaling product development, embedding AI across the value chain, and driving commercial and operational impact.

You will report directly to the CEO, work closely with our board, and serve as the strategic link between Engineering, GTM, Operations, and Data.

Key Responsibilities

Product Strategy & Roadmap


Define and own the end-to-end product vision, strategy, and roadmap across our product offerings
Build and maintain a rigorous prioritization process grounded in customer impact, commercial value, and technical feasibility
Collaborate with Commercial, Operations, and Engineering to align roadmap with business objectives and market feedback
Present roadmap updates and tradeoffs directly to the CEO, Leadership Team, and Board


AI and applied ML leadership


Drive Simply.TV's AI product strategy, shaping how AI is embedded across both external products and internal operations
Design and lead initiatives that apply AI and LLMs to elevate our data platform and editorial workflows
Identify high-impact use cases where AI can enhance customer value or drive operational efficiency
Expand and evolve our AI-powered product features, ensuring they align with customer needs and market trends
Evaluate, test, and integrate cutting-edge AI models, frameworks and toolkits


Product execution and team leadership


Build and lead a high-performing Product & AI team — hiring PMs, ML product leads, and analysts as needed
Establish product development best practices (OKRs, product specs, feedback loops)
Drive clear handoffs with Engineering, ensure on-time delivery, and uphold quality standards
Foster a culture of experimentation, iteration, and customer obsession


Requirements


8+ years of experience in Product Management, with 3+ years in AI/ML product leadership
Deep expertise in applied AI/ML, with a track record of building and scaling AI-native products
Experience working with LLMs and generative AI, ideally in areas like content processing, natural language understanding, or search
Background in or deep familiarity with data-centric companies, with a strong grasp of data pipelines, governance, and quality
Proven ability to set product vision, translate into actionable roadmaps, and drive org-wide alignment
Experience applying AI/ML to complex, high-volume data environments (e.g. media, SaaS, search, marketplaces, etc.)
Sharp product instincts and bias for execution in dynamic, high-growth settings
Executive presence with ability to present to board-level stakeholders and communicate tradeoffs clearly
Strong understanding of the metadata and media landscape is a plus (EPGs, schedules, enrichment, etc.)
Familiarity with modern AI/ML tooling: OpenAI, HuggingFace, LangChain, Pinecone/Weaviate, etc
Ability to engage deeply with engineers and data scientists to scope AI solutions
Solid grasp of LLM architectures, retrieval-augmented generation, fine-tuning, and evaluation metrics
Show more

About Simply.TV

Simply.TV is a high-growth, PE-backed metadata and content discovery platform serving broadcasters, telcos, and streaming platforms globally. Backed by Summit Partners, we recently expanded into the U.S. with the acquisition of FYI (formerly Red Bee Media's metadata division) — marking the first step in our ambitious M&A and global growth strategy.

We operate at the intersection of metadata and content intelligence, powering modern entertainment discovery experiences. We are now building the next generation of data-driven products: blending editorial-grade quality with AI-powered automation, analytics, and personalized discovery.

The role

We're seeking a Head of Product & AI to lead our full product organization and AI product strategy. Title: Senior Data Scientist - Python & Azure
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.

We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The opportunity

Join EY’s fast-growing AI & Data team and help us build a better working world with data. We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist who can solve complex problems with data, create scalable machine learning solutions, and guide clients through their digital transformation journeys. If you're passionate about Python, thrive in Azure environments, and want to work at the forefront of AI innovation - this is your opportunity.

Your Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and data-driven solutions in Azure.
Lead end-to-end data science projects, from problem framing to model implementation and monitoring.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data engineers, cloud architects, and domain experts.
Translate business problems into analytical frameworks and actionable insights.
Present findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Mentor junior data scientists and contribute to EY’s internal knowledge base and best practices.


Skills And Attributes For Success


Strong proficiency in Python for data analysis, machine learning, and scripting.
Proven experience working with Microsoft Azure services (e.g., Azure Machine Learning, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse).
Solid understanding of ML concepts, statistics, and model evaluation techniques.
Experience with data wrangling, feature engineering, and large-scale data processing.
Familiarity with DevOps/MLOps in cloud environments is a strong plus.
Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively.
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data science or advanced analytics roles.
Hands-on project experience deploying models in production environments using Azure.
Business acumen and experience working with clients or in consulting settings.
Proficiency in Danish


Ideally, you’ll also have


Experience with other programming languages (e.g., R, SQL, Scala) or visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Experience in regulated industries such as healthcare, financial services, or energy.
Certifications in Azure Data Science or related cloud technologies.


What We Look For

We are seeking a dynamic and innovative individual who is passionate about continuous learning and professional growth. Flexibility and the ability to collaborate effectively in a global team are essential. We value integrity and expect our team members to uphold the highest ethical standards. Additionally, we are looking for someone who is driven to make a meaningful impact through their work.

What We Offer You

We offer a dynamic and inclusive workplace where innovation is encouraged. You will have opportunities for learning, certification, and career growth. We provide flexible working arrangements and foster global collaboration. You will have access to cutting-edge technologies and tools. Our purpose-driven culture values integrity, collaboration, and impact.

At EY, we’ll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. We’ll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more.

Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.

To help create an equitable and inclusive experience during the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible about any disability-related adjustments or accommodations you may need.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.
